News.text: BANGKOK: Thailand called for speeding up of free-trade talks with India and said the key details of the long-awaited pact should be settled first, leaving minor contentious issues for later discussions. Commerce minister Apiradi Tantraporn, who held talks with India's ambassador to Thailand Bhagwant Singh Bishnoi on Tuesday, said, "The Thai side first wants to settle key details of the long-awaited free-trade pact, leaving minor contentious issues for later discussion." She said both the countries have agreed to accelerate the completion of the Thai-India free trade agreement ( FTA ) after implementing the Early Harvest Programme back in 2004, which covered 82 items. "With disagreement on some topics, Thailand thinks both countries should finalise the agreement in some parts and continue negotiating on the remaining topics," she said. The minister further said that Thai firms are keen to join India's Make in India, Smart Cities and Economic Corridor schemes as they see greater business opportunities amid the strong growth of the Indian economy. Thailand and India signed a framework agreement covering the liberalisation of trade in goods, services and investment on October 9, 2003. It was agreed that they would begin talks and establish a FTA by 2010. Both the countries initially agreed to enact an early harvest scheme (EHS), which meant agreements on one or more topics must be concluded before the scheduled completion of a multi-issue round. The agreement specified tariff reductions under the EHS for 82 items, including fruits, processed food products, gems and jewelery, iron and steel products, auto parts, electronic goods and electric appliances. Tariffs on these products were eliminated on Sept 1, 2006. India and Thailand have also agreed to support the Asean-India FTA and the negotiation of the Regional Comprehensive Economic Partnership by this year. Sources said Asean-India FTA had in some ways overtaken the India-Thailand FTA. India feels Bangkok should be responsive to its demands in the FTA in services sector, sources added. India is Thailand's 15th-biggest trading partner and the largest in South Asia. Over the last five years, the annual two-way trade averaged $8.47 billion. In 2015, two-way trade reached $7.92 billion, which was 1.9 per cent of Thailand's exports. Thailand enjoyed a trade surplus of $2.67 billion with India last year.
News.Heading: Brazil shuns its acting president's political honeymoon
News.text: BRASILIA: Street protests and controversy over the absence of female ministers clouded Brazilian acting President Michel Temer's political honeymoon on Monday as he began his first full week in power. Temer took over from president Dilma Rousseff last week after the Senate voted to open an impeachment trial on charges that she illegally manipulated the budget. The 75-year-old center-right leader has vowed to reverse Rousseff's leftist course in an attempt to haul Brazil back from its deepest recession in decades. Although a cabinet, which will be reduced from a bloated 32 ministries to 23, has already been named, there was a delay to the nomination in the key post of central bank head. New Finance Minister Henrique Meirelles , whose early pronouncements are being carefully watched by the markets, had been due to announce the nominee Monday but put it off for a day, Brazilian newspapers reported. In a television interview late Sunday, Temer vowed to unite Brazil after months of increasingly divisive debate over the impeachment of Rousseff, who accuses Temer of leading a coup. "Unification of the country means unifying political parties, employers and workers, and making a joint effort in Brazilian society so that we can get out of the crisis we find ourselves in," he said on Globo television. But just days into the job, Temer finds himself under steady attack from the left. Jeering and pot banging could be heard in parts of Rio de Janeiro and Sao Paulo during his television interview, a form of protest that used to dog Rousseff to the point where she began avoiding broadcast appearances. Street protests also took place Sunday in several cities, including the capital Brasilia and the financial center Sao Paulo. Another was held Monday in Rio de Janeiro, which hosts the Olympics in less than three months. Activists occupied offices of the education and culture ministries, which are being merged under Temer's plan. Although the scale of opposition demonstrations is so far modest, Rousseff's fight against impeachment in the Senate trial, which could take as long as six months, means that Temer will have trouble settling in. "The popular reaction to the coup continues and the protests should continue," Rui Falcao, president of Rousseff's Workers' Party, said on Monday. Polls show Temer is almost as unpopular as Rousseff. His naming of a cabinet comprised entirely of white men has put him on the defensive. In his Sunday interview he looked to sidestep the controversy, insisting that women would be given powerful posts, although not at ministerial level. But his reference to women as "representatives of the feminine world" prompted derision on opposition social media. Another hurdle facing Temer is to make good on his promise to cut costs and streamline the overburdened state budget. He has promised to slash up to 5,000 civil service jobs and says that he, unlike Rousseff, is in a position to deal with Congress over unpopular budget reductions. Temer was due to meet Monday with the main unions to discuss social security reforms. But one of the biggest groups, the CUT, boycotted the session. A constitutional lawyer who was Rousseff's vice president thanks to an uneasy coalition between his PMDB party and the Workers' Party, Temer says he feels free to act in the interests of the country because he likely won't seek election in the scheduled 2018 presidential vote. "I realize I don't have popular backing," he said. But "I don't have to make gestures or do things leading to an eventual reelection. I can even be, let's say, unpopular, because as long as I produce benefits for the country that's enough for me."
News.Heading: Egypt president says no theory favoured on EgyptAir crash
News.text: CAIRO: Egypt's President Abdel Fattah al-Sisi said on Sunday that no theory was being favoured on why the EgyptAir MS804 plunged into the Mediterranean Sea and that Egypt was using a submarine to locate the black boxes. The Airbus A320 carrying 66 people had crashed into the sea while flying from Paris to Cairo early on Thursday, and some wreckage has been found. However, the black boxes are still missing. Egypt's aviation minister had said that terrorism was a more likely reason than technical failure, but Sisi said in a televised address that "all the theories are possible". He added, "There is no particular theory we can affirm right now." Sisi said a submarine that could operate at a depth of 9,800 feet under sea level had been deployed on Sunday to search for the black boxes. "This (submarine) moved today in the direction of the plane crash because we are working hard to retrieve the two boxes, which are the black boxes," he said. A civil aviation official had on Sunday said that search teams had found none of the passengers' bodies.
News.Heading: Uruguay's Mujica: Venezuela's Maduro is 'crazy as a goat'
News.text: CARACAS: Called "mad as a goat" by Uruguay's Jose Mujica this week, Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro retorted laughingly on Thursday that the former president was right - but he was only crazy with love for his country. "Yes, I'm mad as a goat, it's true," Maduro told a rally of the ruling Socialist Party. "I'm mad with love for Venezuela, for the Bolivarian Revolution, for Chavez and his example," he added, smiling as the crowd cheered, in a reference to former President Hugo Chavez. Mujica, a fellow leftist who ruled Uruguay between 2010 and 2015, said on Wednesday he respected Maduro, but still thought he and others in Venezuela were "crazy" for attacking each other rather than sitting down to resolve problems. Amid a deep economic crisis, Venezuela's opposition is pushing for a recall referendum to oust Maduro. Government officials say that will not happen this year, and security forces have been blocking protest marches demanding the vote. Numerous foreign countries are calling for dialogue, but there is deep hostility and suspicion between Maduro's government and the opposition Democratic Unity coalition.
News.Heading: South Africa compensates 750 families for apartheid land loss
News.text: JOHANNESBURG: Some 750 South African families who say they were pushed out of their land on a natural reserve during apartheid will be handed over $5 million in compensation, President Jacob Zuma said on Saturday. "We have come together about land, to restore the rights of our people who were dispossessed," Zuma said in Kruger, South Africa's largest natural reserve. "Today we are contributing to the reversal of the apartheid legacy by compensating six communities, three from Limpopo, and another three from Mpumalanga, all who were dispossessed through harsh apartheid laws," he added. "We are awarding a total amount of 84 million rand ($5.4 million, 4.8 million euros) to six communities," Zuma said. The 757 families who make up the six communities are the descendants of people expelled starting from the year 1930. While apartheid officially started in 1948, racial segregation began earlier. They will be the first group to receive compensation on their claims on the Kruger national park, Zuma said. "We celebrate this milestone in the history of Land Restitution in our country," he said. The government has decided to compensate the families rather than return their land because Kruger is now a major natural reserve. Since the end of apartheid rule in 1994, 3.3 million hectares (8.2 million acres) of land have been restituted to 1.9 million people, Nomfundo Ntloko-Gobodo, an official at the agriculture ministry, told AFP. Many white South African farmers fear that the country may take the path of Zimbabwe, where the state-sanctioned seizure of white-owned farmland starting in 2000 left the agricultural sector in ruin.
News.Heading: Duterte to offer Cabinet posts to rebels
News.text: MANILA: Presumptive Philippine President-elect Rodrigo Duterte said Monday he will re-impose the death penalty, offer Cabinet posts to communist rebels, and move to amend the constitution to give more power to the provinces, in some of his first policy pronouncements since winning last week's election based on an unofficial count. In his first nationally televised news conference since the May 9 vote, Duterte also said he will launch a major military offensive to destroy Abu Sayyaf extremists on southern Jolo Island. The announcements, a sharp departure from current government policy, reflect his brash campaign pledge to end crime and corruption in the impoverished nation in three to six months. Police officials have said the plan is undoable, and that crime remains prevalent in Davao city, where Duterte has served as mayor for more than 22 years. The military has been fighting a decades-long Marxist insurgency in the countryside. Duterte said he would likely offer the Cabinet posts of environment and natural resources, agrarian reform, social welfare, and labor to the communist rebels. "They are the most vigilant group in the Philippines about labor so they would get it," Duterte said. The move would likely be strongly opposed by big business and industry. Duterte said he would ask Congress to re-impose the death penalty, which has been suspended since 2006 in the face of staunch opposition from the dominant Roman Catholic Church. Capital punishment by hanging, he said, should be imposed for heinous crimes, and criminals convicted of killing along with robbery and rape should be meted "double the hanging." "After the first hanging, there will be another ceremony for the second time until the head is completely severed from the body," he said. Commission on Human Rights Chairman Chito Gascon said his agency opposes the death penalty and would block any attempt to re-impose it, adding that the constitution forbids cruel and degrading punishments like hanging. "In a country where the rule of law has so many loopholes and problems, what will happen is the possibility of a mistaken conviction," Gascon said by telephone. Duterte also plans to switch to a federal form of government, aiming to give more power and resources to regions, including the country's south, where Davao city is located. Such a change would require an amendment to the constitution. In a populist move, Duterte said he would sell the presidential yacht and use the money to buy medical equipment for military and police personnel. "When people are hungry and jobless ...it would be an obscene thing" to have the luxury vessel lying unused, he said. TV network ABS-CBN also quoted him as telling reporters in Davao late Sunday that he plans to ban the use of luxury cars among his Cabinet members and will use his personal pickup truck as his official presidential vehicle. Duterte reiterated on Monday his vow to control illegal drugs and crime, even if it means losing the presidency or his life. "Stop messing with me, because I have a sacred promise to save the next generation from the evil of drugs," he told critics. He also promised to cut government red tape and remove corrupt officials. Duterte said "contaminated" police generals facing corruption cases should "get out now" before he assumes office. If not, they should prepare to be sent to invade the Abu Sayyaf militants, who have been blamed for multiple kidnappings and beheadings. "And if you are taken hostage there, say your `Our Fathers' because I will never, never pay anything to retrieve you," he added. Army Lt. Gen. Ricardo Visaya, whom Duterte is considering to head the military, said he met over the weekend with the mayor, who told him he wanted troops to finish off the Abu Sayyaf within the president's six-year term and to back up the police in going after drug syndicates. After the news conference, Duterte met with the ambassadors of China, Japan and Israel. Chinese Ambassador Zhao Jianhua gave him a book of writings by Chinese President Xi Jinping.
News.Heading: What IS does is un-Islamic, inhuman: Muslims leaders
News.text: MUMBAI: Muslim leaders have dismissed Islamic State's latest propaganda video focused on India as a can of lies aimed at disrupting social harmony in India. "If you have friends like Islamic State, who needs enemies?" said senior community leader Ghulam Peshimam, elaborating that Islamic State is the worst enemy of Muslims."They can't win over Indian Muslims till India has vibrant democracy, secularism and a fair justice system. Yes, polarization of Indian society may create a fertile ground for IS to find some traction here," he said. Muslim leaders unequivo cally denounced the IS which, through the video, attacks some Muslim politicians and clerics for creating an alliance with "kafirs (infidels)". "Indian Muslims reject terrorism of Islamic State. We don't need any advocacy from a violent group like Daesh or ISIS," said All India United Democratic Front leader Badruddin Ajmal whose photograph has been juxtaposed with picture of riot victims in the video. "The fact that we have voting rights here and enjoy religious freedom speaks volumes. Indian Muslims will not get attracted by ISIS propaganda. " Pervez Lakdawala of Indian Union Muslim League said IS cannot be sympathetic to Muslims as it represents a medieval mindset. Islamic scholar Maulana Wahiduddin Khan said, "Islam is a religion of peace. What ISIS does is unIslamic and inhuman. Indian Muslim youths will not fall in their trap. The video is perhaps issued to lure more youths from India that fortunately has not provided them many recruits."
News.Heading: Twins by birth and by marks: Score 95%
News.text: Juli and Shingo Sarkar, a pair of fraternal twins who studied at Mumbai's R N Podar School, managed to get an identical score of 95% in their Class XII CBSE results announced on Saturday. They scored an identical 475 and got 95 each in Physics and Chemistry. The twins of mixed origin - born to a Japanese mother and a Bengali father - have been in Mumbai throughout their schooling. Juli said, "We were adamant about not attending tuition or coaching. We studied on our own with help from our school and teachers. It was fun for us because we could study together and quiz each other. There was always a healthy competition between us. I believe time management is very important." She added that the siblings would also devote adequate time other activities. Both are state-level athletes and have also participated in several dance competitions. Shingo said, "Since Juli and I had different strengths and weaknesses, we would often help each other. My parents have also always supported us. My mother, Kazumi Sarkar, who teaches Japanese at IIT-Bombay took a break this year to help us." Their father, Arup, is a business consultant. The twins now plan to head to Japan. While Shingo has got into Chemical Engineering at Nagoya University, Juli will study Environmental Science in University of Tokyo.
News.Heading: 8 MU employees held for smuggling out engg answer sheets, helping students modify them
News.text: MUMBAI: In what could be another blot on the reputation of the 159-year-old Mumbai University , eight employees were caught by Bhandup police on Friday for sneaking answer sheets of first-year engineering students out of the examination house. The answer sheets were given to a few students who took them home, wrote the answers and returned them to these officials. The eight accused were caught while trying to place the answer sheets back. They were found to be in possession of at least 92 answer sheets of Applied Mathematics - an exam conducted on May 11. Those arrested include custodian (havaldar in university's hierarchy) of the answer sheets Prabhakar Vaze (50), three clerks on contract and four peons hired on contract. Bhandup police received a tip-off about the scam last week and acted promptly. The accused had planned to put all papers back in place by Friday as they were to be scanned on Saturday for evaluation. Most of the seized papers were from exam centres in Kamothe, Khargar, Airoli and Karjat. "We first zeroed in on Manoj Shingade, 22, a commerce student, who acted as a middleman for his friend. On Friday we got information that Shingade was coming to Bhandup station to hand over an answer sheet to a man. We nabbed him around 7am. He revealed that a university peon, Mithun More, helped him get the paper. We nabbed More too," said sub-inspector Shivshankar Bhosale of the Bhandup police who is investigating the case. The answer sheet recovered from Shingade contained serial number 506981228 and QP code 528704, besides the candidate's seat number, 11200349. Police suspect that page numbers three to 27 were written with a different pen. "We will sending the papers for forensic test too," said an officer. More said seven more people were involved and Vaze was the kingpin. "When we went to nab Vaze he was drinking beer outside a country liquor shop near the Kalina campus. We searched the bag with him and found 35 answer sheets of Applied Mathematics. We later took custody of all the accused and by then had seized 92 answer sheets," added a cop. Interestingly, the accused tried to prevent arrest citing a court order stating police had to make inquiries before arrest. "We had evidence and the papers were found in their possession. We nabbed the agents, statements of witnesses and hence we arrested them," said an officer. A team led by senior police inspector Shripad Kale had conducted the operation and informed university officials about the police action. DCP Sangramsingh Nishandar said they were probing if more people were involved. Mumbai University's in-charge examination controller said MU will act on the police complaint and call for an urgent meeting on Monday to decide the future course of action against the employees. Another university official said engineering answer sheets are assessed online. Though papers are to be scanned within two to three days of the exam, it is at times delayed as there are only three to four scanning machines. "The papers are then kept longer in the store room," said an official. "We do not know at what stage the papers were taken out from the examination house. There is a possibility the papers were sneaked out from the store. Since these staffers are even responsible for transporting papers from the centres to the Kalina campus, it could have been removed at that stage too. We will wait for the police report," said an official. The accused have been booked under sections 420 (cheating), 406 (criminal breach of trust), 408 (criminal breach of trust by clerk or servant), 34 (acts done by several persons in furtherance of common intention) of the IPC and sections 7 (copying) and section 8 (abetment for copying) of the Maharashtra Protection of Malpractices at University and other specified board examination Act, 1982. All accused were produced before court and remanded in police custody till May 25. "All the 92 students, whose answer sheets have been seized, will be made accused and later arrested," said a cop. Police are searching houses of those arrested, besides scanning their call records and bank accounts. Police have seized Rs 1.18 lakh from the eight accused, including Rs 45,000 from Vaze alone.
News.Heading: My first girlfriend was a Gujarati: Vishal Malhotra
News.text: Actor Vishal Malhotra, who was in Vadodara for the auditions of the Zee TV show India's Best Cine Stars Ki Khoj, says that he is fond of Gujaratis. Says Vishal, "I have grown up with several Gujarati friends. The school where I studied (in Juhu) had several Gujaratis, including the trustee. I love the fact that they are extremely friendly and easygoing people. In fact, my first girlfriend was a Gujarati! Besides, being a foodie, I love Gujarati delicacies."
News.Heading: Sunny Leone sizzles in Hyderabad's New Year party
News.text: When one of the hottest actors comes to town to perform on New Year's Eve, it is but natural that hordes of people throng the place. That's exactly what happened when Bollywood Sunny Leone descended on the city to give Hyderabadis a memorable evening to remember. And boy did she nail it right! Performing to her famous songs Pink Lips, and Baby Doll, she also shook a leg to Dhating Naach and had the crowd hooting and grooving along with her. Once the clock struck 12, the pretty actress came back on stage, along with her husband, Daniel Weber, wishing those present at the venue a happy new year. Now this is what we call the perfect dhamakedaar beginning to the New Year!
News.Heading: Meet M-towns poster boys of politics
News.text: The election campaigning is over. The stage is set. There's a palpable excitement in the air as the State gears up for the polls today. Many voters would have already made up their mind as to whom they should vote for depending on their agendas, allegiance and even their personality traits. Over the years, Mollywood too has showcased some interesting political personas. Who could forget the classic Sandesham, which had Sreenivasan and Jayaram as two warring brothers belonging to different political outfits? Its scribe Sreenivasan presented a satire that reflected Kerala .s politicians and their ideologies. In fact, Mollywood has brought to the fore leaders that fit every mould from the scheming politicians played by Narendra Prasad in Thalasthanam to Janardhanan's performance in films mimicking former Chief Minister, late E K Nayanar. Trivandrum Times lists out diverse politicians enacted by our top heroes: The master manipulator: Biju Menon in Vellimoonga Biju Menon's Mammachan is as shrewd as they come in the world of politics . To expedite his ascension in his political career, he joins a national party that has no roots in Kerala. He is given candidacy in an upcoming election but expresses his disinterest, hinting it would cut short his rise to a national-level career. How the wily tactician uses his wits to win the election and also the heart of his girl make him a sure-shot ballot winner in our list. Chief political strategist: Mohanlal in Peruchazhi While Mohanlal's Jagannathan is not vying for a seat in the comic caper, he knows exactly how the political system works and how to win votes. His astuteness makes the minister of his own party feel insecure forcing him to pack off Jagan to the USA as a political consultant for electing the governor in California. His modus operandi actually turns the table in the favour of his client as he uses the tried-and-tested policies of Indian politicians such as dividing the society on the basis of race and promising freebies. From a naive to model politician: Fahadh Faasil in Oru Indian Pranayakatha Fahadh plays Kottayam-based politician Aimanan Sidharthan, who is the blue-eyed boy of the district president of the party. His motives are driven by his ambition to be a candidate for the upcoming election. But a last minute change dashes his hopes as the high command decides to field the daughter of an influential leader. While he is duty bound, Sidharthan refuses to campaign for the chosen candidate and decides to take upon another job entrusted by the president, with an aim of earning some quick bucks. In the course of time he realises his true calling and becomes a model politician. Young, brash & arrogant: Tovino Thomas in ABCD Tovino's Akhilesh Varma, a young and brash politician, breathed fresh life to such characters that are usually played by veteran actors. Akhilesh, who is thrust to power after the death of his father, bends rules to amass popularity and is also media savvy, pretending to be familiar with the ways of his voters by having food from a street shop just for the benefit of the camera. The political scion: Dileep in Lion Dileep plays a young politician who gets pitted against his dad, a political heavyweight who dislodges the previous government to fulfil his ambition to be the next Chief Minister. The father-son contest in the movie showed that when it comes to winning the polls, even blood relations take a back seat! The family man: Mammootty in Nayam Vyakthamakkunnu The megastar plays V Sukumaran, a youth leader of a minor party who mostly depends on his wife to support his career and family. His honesty and dedication are taken for granted by his superiors as they pressure him on dealing with the nasty issues and also by his juniors who take bribe in his name. Pressures in his political career soon spill into his family life forcing his wife to leave him. However, he soon gets appointed as a minister but his opponents drag the issues with his family to the forefront.
News.Heading: Celebs who kept 'investigating' eyes on their spouses
News.text: Being a celeb means a constant public glare and thus most celeb relations become easy targets of scrutiny. READ: Brian Austin Green seeking spousal support from Megan Fox But there are celebs who have gone a step ahead and kept their exes or spouses under constant watch to keep a tab on their `activities.' The latest to join the bandwagon is Megan Fox, who wants to keep a sharp eye on the activities of her ex-husband Austin Green. Here are few more who did the same: MEGAN FOX ON BRIAN AUSTIN GREEN (2015) While Megan Fox was fighting a custody battle with ex-husband Austin Green, who demanded spouse support on account of his inability to work due to an injury , Megan has decided to keep an eye on his activities since she feels he has been `rather too active' recently to be able to not work, and his claim of inability to work is not true. BEYONCE ON JAY Z (2015) While Beyonce and Jay Z have been together for a long time and all seems fine, there have been reports that Beyonce recently hired a private investigator to keep an eye on Jay while she is away and report back to her on whatever Jay is doing. Sources, reportedly, have spelt trouble in paradise. KHLOE KARDASHIAN ON LAMAR ODOM (2013) Khloe might have been the first one to reach by his side in the hospital after his recent collapse due to drug overdose, but when they were married, Khloe had hired a tail to find evidence against Lamar for cheating on her. And the results were quite what she had expect ed, Lamar was found to have as many as five mistresses. MARIA SHRIVER ON ARNOLD SCHWARZENEGGER (2011) What ended as one of the most expensive divorce settlements between Maria Shriver and Arnold Schwarzenegger, started with Maria hiring a private investigator (PI) to find out how much did Arnold worth and how much money she was dealing with. Arnold's flamboyant spending on his illegitimate family only added fuel to the fire. BRITNEY SPEARS ON KEVIN FEDERLINE (2007) Custody battles can really get dirty, and the same happened with Britney Spears, who hired a private investigator for keeping an eye on Kevin Federline's activities. Britney wanted to use Kevin's unruly behavior as an evidence in the court to get the custody of her children. VENESSA BRYANT ON KOBE BRYANT (2011) It all started in 2003 when Kobe was accused of raping a 19 year old hotel staff, but he refused saying it was `consensual.' Since then Vanessa knew her husband was a cheater, but she wait ed for the right time to hit back. She hired a PI in 2011 to gather enough evidence to file for a divorce and get the right amount of alimony . JUANITA JORDAN ON MICHAEL JORDAN (1988) The legendary basketball player Michael Jordan found himself out of sorts when his long time wife Juanita Vanoy filed for divorce citing `irreconcilable difference.' While the trouble had started long back in their marriage, Juanita hired a PI much later to gether all the right evi dences to win her an amicable divorce. News.Heading: Acceptance by society is the greatest recognition for me
News.text: It is not easy being a transgender in India, let alone in Kerala, where they are ridiculed to such an extent that they keep away from all kinds of public spaces. But transgender and dancer Jazz D' Souza decided to take the chance when she auditioned for a TV reality show in a popular Malayalam channel. Not only did Jazz get selected, she received applause for her performances in the show, while becoming the first third gender contestant to participate in a TV show, probably the first in the history of Indian television. It is more than a personal victory but what is important is that she felt loved and accepted, says a beaming Jazz, as she opens up to Kochi Times about her bitter past, journey to the dance floor and dreams in life. I had a traumatic childhood I don't want to reveal my original name or other details but I was born and brought up in Pandalam, Pathanamthitta. I was outwardly a boy but my feminine mannerisms made me a butt of jokes among children in school. So like in the case of any other member of my community, my childhood and teenage were filled with horror. My family too couldn't accept my wish to live my life as a woman. There were times when I really wanted to end my life because of the continual abuses I had suffered. But I had strong hope that I would succeed one day. Being a member of the third gender, I was a loner in society. Public toilets were always a haunting experience. I have had to suffer physical abuses when I used the men's rooms. Women were more understanding and they have always allowed me to use their washrooms. The turning point One day, seven years ago, I ran away from home, unable to bear the torture. I reached Mumbai in pursuit of a livelihood.There is a space in Mumbai for transgenders like me and I started working as a bar dancer there. After saving enough money, I decided to undergo a sexual reassignment surgery. Thus I became a female two years ago, and got christened as Jazz D'Souza. After my transition into a woman, I was quite determined to succeed in life. I was always fond of modelling and wanted a glamourous profession, which is why I opted to be a dancer. One day I came across a notification online about the auditions for a dance reality show on a Malayalam channel. I am a self-taught dancer but being a transgender, I was not sure if I would get selected. But the producers of the show were impressed by my performance and I was in! At first, I was shy but the other contestants, judges and the hosts gave me a warm welcome and that boosted my confidence. I felt loved and appreciated as a contestant It takes several rounds for a contestant to become popular in the reality show, but I received lots of applause and love from the audience at my very first performance itself. It was the greatest recognition for a transgender like me. Being a member of the most ignored community in the country, the acceptance instilled hope in me. Just when I thought things couldn't get any better, my favourite actress Shobana, who was one of the judges, praised my dance performance and asked me if I would like to enter the film industry. I was also fortunate enough to share the stage with her for a few dance steps and it was a dream come true for me. I now have an identity The show gave me an identity and meaning in life. Now, wherever I go, people recognise me as a celebrity and wish me luck. The comments and support I receive from well-wishers around the world too make me feel blessed. I feel I can now walk down the streets as a member of the third gender with my head held high. I can't describe the feeling when young girls and boys approach me calling chechi and take selfies with me. It doesn't matter if I get eliminated from the show, because I got a perfect platform to showcase my talents and create a space for myself in society. My parents are yet to accept me The best moment was when the team dedicated a video album to me "The story of a transgender's life" in its 12th episode. The video was based on the incidents in my life. It went viral and even Bollywood actor Varun Dhawan shared it. It made my parents contact me after a long time. But they were still not fully happy with me and told me to live with dignity. They had seen my performances, and even though they did not invite me back home, my mother said I performed well on stage, which gave me some comfort. I wish to be an actress, social worker and mother During childhood my dream was to become an air hostess. There are countries which have transgenders as cabin crew and I wish our government too would allow it. Now I want to become an actress. I know I can't be a heroine, but I want to essay powerful roles in films. I also want to make use of my fame as a voice for my community and serve as a social worker. I want to be in the forefront to help people of my community live a dignified life. I also wish to get married to a man who will respect me. After becoming Jazz, I received several good proposals but when I reveal my identity to them, they withdraw. That saddens me. I hope to adopt a child as well and have a family, like any normal human being.
News.Heading: Sairat's star-couple bags Rs 5cr bonus
News.text: Producers of the film are feeling super-generous as film crosses Rs 60-cr mark. It is appraisal season, after all. And why should film stars be any different? The leading lady and man of the biggest blockbuster in Marathi cinematic history, Sairat , have been awarded a bonus of Rs 5 crore each by its benevolent (and delighted) producers. The film itself is being seen as a landmark in Marathi film history. Cinemas to meet with the demand have opened 12 am and 3 am slots in rural Maharashtra, a phenomenon never heard of in the hinterland. But so astounding has been the word-of-mouth for the blockbuster that the film has garnered Rs 60 crore at the box-office. The actors, who had been signed on for a meagre Rs 4 lakh, will now be given Rs 5 crore each, as announced by producer Nitin Keni , CEO-Founder of EsselVision Productions, and co-producer Nikhil Sane, who pulled off the modern classic on a shoestring budget of Rs 4 crore. "Yes, we are planning this as a small gesture of goodwill for the cast and it is not only the actors who will be receiving certain amounts of money, but also the extended cast and crew. We are finalising the paperwork, but at the same time are hoping that we do not have to close our accounting books soon, since the shows are still going houseful. Last week, there were three shows of Captain America: Civil War, three of Azhar and eight of Sairat in Mumbai suburbs," Keni laughs. Read: What Bollywood has taught Sairat director The career-defining roles have come to both Akash Thosar, 22, and Rinku Rajguru , 15, with the sort of serendipity that rustic fairytales are made of: eight months ago, filmmaker Nagraj Manjule spotted Akash Thosar, a local pehelwan, at the Jeur railway station as the youngster prepared to board a train to his hometown, Solapur. Manjule had written a story about a young boy falling in love with a girl, set against the backdrop of caste discrimination. He instinctively felt that if this beefed-up lad lost his bulk, he'd be great for the part. Akash, who lives in Pune's Aundh area with his parents and four younger siblings - two sisters and two brothers - was headed to the Jeur Kushti Akhada for a state-level championship. His father is a retired accountant and his mother a housewife.Akash supported his large family with the money he won at kushti matches, each victory bringing in Rs 1,000. Life was hard. "I went up to him and said that I wanted to cast him as the hero of my next film. He thought I was joking, so I told him that I was the director of Fandry (the 2014 National Award winner for First Film of a Director). We exchanged numbers, I told him that I'd be back in three weeks and that he'd be perfect for the role if he wasn't so muscular. He showed up at the station three weeks later, eight kilos lighter," recalls Manjule, who had already finalised Rinku Rajguru, a local from Akluj village in Solapur, who loved to dance, for the female lead. Movie Review: Sairat Rinku's journey to tinsel town is equally fascinating: she hails from one of the more well-to-do farmer families of Akluj in Solapur district. Rinku was prepping up for her ninth standard exams at the Jijamata Kanya Prashala and confesses that she did even not know "audition" meant. "Nagraj dada told me `Tu acting karsheel?' I said yes, dancing a bit and spouting a few lines. He gave me the role. I had only 15 days to study for my final exams and I still scored 81 per cent," she says proudly. The process to stardom was rigorous to say the least: for two months, the cast was holed up at Manjule's Pune home, reading the script and prepping for the role. Six months later, Sairat released on February 17 with English subtitles in 400 theatres. At the end of the second week, the total num ber of shows went up from 8500 to 14,000. "The Sairat craze has taken all of us by surprise. Who would've thought a Marathi-speaking Romeo and Juliet would eventually hit a 60-crore mark, a first in Marathi cinema. It's gone out of hand with midnight and 3 am shows being introduced at a hall in Satara," informs producer Nitin Keni. Also read: Sairat records in Hollywood; first Indian film to do so Keni though also insists that the fan tastic story and the score by composer duo Ajay-Atul is behind the film's dream run in theatres. "The rough cut was complete and we decided to gamble another Rs 60-70 lakh by sending Ajay-Atul to the US to record live music with 100 instrumentalists and musicians performing at the Sony Theatre in Los Angeles. Guess that paid off too," the producer explains, pointing out that the makers will not be selling the remake rights of the film, even if the largest production house in the country offers them a deal. "We are rolling with the Telugu remake of the film first, followed by a Gujarati version, and, of course, Hindi. The idea is to not make a sequel, but replicate this success in different regions," adds Keni. Aamir Khan praises Marathi film Sairat, asks his fans to watch the movie 00:54 Keni hosted a grand success bash at a Juhu five-star on Saturday night, which began at 11pm, when the teenagers who turned superstars overnight walked in. "If one year ago, someone had told me that I would be a superstar, I would have laughed," says Akash, who confesses that he is more used to being called Prashant, his Sairat character's name by now. "Mere parents and friends khush hai and sab mere saath selfie chahte hai, main isi main khush hoon. Aamir Khan and Irrfan Khan ne bhi meri taarif ki. Jin logon ko screen pe dekhkar main taali yan bajata tha, voh mujhe aaj screen par dekh rahe hai," he says. Ask him on his signing amount of Rs 4 lakh and what he plans to do with his five crores, he says, "Nahi, starting main toh koi contract nahi tha..." and the phone is taken away by the film's publicist, who says that contracts cannot be discussed with the media at this moment. Rinku, on the other hand, reveals via her publicist that she does not want to discuss her contract or the money she is going to receive. "I have not gone home since the film started and have been living in Pune and Mumbai. I want to continue studying and go home," confides the 15-year-old, who bagged a Special Mention at the 63rd National Awards for her performance as Archana `Archie' Patil. But she is instantly happy when asked about what she'll remember about Sairat for the rest of her life. "When we were shooting, 'Zingat' played for three days, and all we did was dance. That is what I want to do for the rest of my life," Rinku beams. WATCH: Zingat from Sairat:
News.Heading: Censor cuts irkes Rajeshwari Poornachandra Tejaswi
News.text: Wife of late writer Poornachadra Tejaswi, Rajeshwari Poornachandra Tejaswi, has raised objections against Regional Censor Board, for muting some of the dialogues in the movie Kiragoorina Gayyaligalu, which is the adaptation of the short story penned by her husband Poornachandra Tejaswi. Rajeshwari has reportedly said that people have read the same words in the book which was also retained when it was staged as a play. Dialogues are the soul of the movie; it is disappointing that audiences cannot enjoy those muted words. The film Kiragoorina Gayyaligalu which is currently in theaters has Shwetha Srivatsav, Sukrutha Wagle, Manasa Joshi and Kishore in the lead roles. The project has been directed by D Suman Kittur.
News.Heading: Is Mahesh Babu playing himself in Koratala Siva's film?
News.text: "Oorini dattatha theeskodam antey jebulo dabbulu theesi rangulu, roadlesi elipothaanannukunnara. Veedni, vaadni, vaadni, vaadni, veellandarni.. ninnu motthaanni dattatha theeskunna," thunders Mahesh in the recently released teaser Srimanthudu. Namrata was quoted as saying, "We are going to work on several small details before proceeding further." While there has been no news of any development about the actor adopting his native village, but the idea seems to have inspired director Koratala Siva enough to come-up with a plot. News.Heading: Girish Kulkarni in Hrithik-Yami starrer Kaabil
News.text: Actor Girish Kulkarni is a busy man these days. The actor whose directorial debut 'Jaundya Na Balasaheb' is in the post-production stage, recently started shooting for the Hrithik Roshan-Yami Gautam starrer 'Kaabil' too. Read: Girish Kulkarni turns director with Ajay-Atul production Speaking to us after returning from the shoot, Girish confirmed his association with the film. "We have just started shooting and it will go on for another two-three months. I play a character that has shades of grey. I wanted to do a mainstream Hindi film for a while and am doing just that with 'Kaabil'," he said, without divulging anymore details. News.Heading: Gujarati theatre needs better writers: Rajeev Mehta
News.text: Veteran actor Rajeev Mehta, known for his superb role play in TV shows like Khichdi and Baa Bahoo Aur Baby, says that there is a dearth of good writers today when it comes to Gujarati theatre. Mehta, who has been shooting in Vadodara for Kirtan Patel's urban Gujarati flick Bas Ek Chance, says, "There are a few people like Saumya Joshi who are doing commendable work for Gujarati theatre. However, the number is very few and there is a dearth of good writers today, due to which Gujarati plays are suffering. If we get more good writers, I am sure that theatre lovers in the state will show their appreciation for Gujarati plays."
News.Heading: Director Saravanan injured in car accident
News.text: Engeyum Eppodhum fame director Saravanan, who was injured in a car accident today has been admitted in hospital. The young director who was traveling along with his assistant Gautham met with an accident near Perambalur today morning at around 10 a.m. It is said that the two were traveling along the Chennai-Trichy highway when their car's tire burst, which led to the accident. Both are said to have minor injuries and are being treated at the Government hospital in Perambalur. Saravanan began his career as an assistant director under director A R Murugadoss and has gone on to direct movies like Engeyum Eppodhum, Ivan Veramathiri and Valiyavan.
News.Heading: At 7 hours 20 minutes, this is the world's longest movie trailer
News.text: How would you like to watch the trailer of a movie that is set to be released in 2020? Yes? Okay. Set aside 7 hours and 20 minutes. You read that right. The trailer of Swedish film Ambiance alone is longer than the three Matrix movies combined. Wait. If the trailer alone is about as long as the first four Harry Potter movies, how long is the movie itself? 720 hours. That's a whopping 30 days. And this trailer has been termed a 'short trailer'. The first trailer, which the makers called 'teaser', had been released in 2014, and was 72 minutes long. Another trailer is set to be released in 2018. This, a 'longer' trailer, will be 72 hours long. The trailer does not feature a single cut according to the makers of the film. It is entirely black and white and does not feature a single line of dialogue. And it features only two actors. And here's is the truly eye-popping thing about this movie, according to a note from the fimmakers. "The final film will be screened once syncronised on all the continents and then deleted. Ambiance is 720 hours long (30 days) and will be shown in its full length on a single occasion syncronised in all the continents of the world and then destroyed. Ambiance will be the longest film made that doesn't exist." Ambiance is set to be released on December 31, 2020. It is being directed by Swedish filmmaker Anders Weberg, in what seems to be a goodbye ode to cinema. Incidentally, the longest film ever made is also Swedish. 'Logistics', released in 2012, was 857 hours (35 days and 17 hours) long. Ambiance, when it is released, is set to become the second longest film. Watch the 'short trailer' of Ambiance:
News.Heading: It would be stupid of me to try and emulate my dad: Goutham
News.text: It's incredible what working out for five hours a day, five times a week, for 140 days did to Goutham's perception of himself. From being any regular 29-year-old guy who was conscious of his flabby 78-kg frame, the actor has transformed into a mean machine who isn't shy of wearing just his body. "Oh, it feels great to have a ripped body, more so because I've never been this fit. I weigh 70.5 kg, mostly muscle. Looking at myself after working out, I feel good enough to face the world shirtless," exclaims Goutham, settling down for a chat at a coffee lounge in Jubilee Hills. "Mee cinema eppudu start avuthundi...?" (when will your film shoot start?) enquires the waiter while taking an order for green tea. "Next month," Goutham replies, smiling. "I can't wait to start shooting for it," he adds excitedly, referring to his upcoming film Manu. When returning from a friend's wedding in December last year, director Phani told Goutham that he'd have to go shirtless for a couple of scenes in the film. And that's what motivated him to hit the gym. "I started working out from December 15. We had a shoot on May 3 and I had to get in shape for it," recalls Goutham, who's gotten quite used to counting calories of his meals. Getting a handle over what you eat is the most difficult part of getting in shape, he reckons. "It's only a shade easier than getting the lower abs toned. I've been on a low carb-high protein diet and haven't eaten a single sweet dish all this while. For someone with a sweet tooth like me, it's a lesson in giving up," he remarks, with a smile. Dad Brahmanandam though was just worried about his face. "'Arrey, moham padayipothundi ra...' (your face is losing its charm), dad would remark, after watching me shrink. But after he saw my pictures, he was super excited," shares Goutham, who is playing a painter in the film tipped to be a psychological thriller. "Manu is a very intriguing character. He lives two lives a hotshot painter by the day who turns into a thief at night," explains the actor, who is confident that this film would prove to be the elusive 'hit.' Box-office success has eluded him since making his debut as a 19-year-old back in 2004. "It was a dream debut for me. I was still in college then and was rubbing shoulders with the likes of Tanikella Bharani, MS Narayana, Sunil, Telangana Sakuntala and my dad. K Raghavendra Rao worked as the directorial supervisor," he recalls. The film was an average grosser, but Goutham got noticed and more importantly, he met wife Jyotsna while working on the film she is the daughter of the film's cameraman, Srinivas Reddy. "We began seeing each other much later, we were just friends back then," says Goutham. Post his debut, Goutham took a break from showbiz to complete studies. He then went on to train under acting guru Satyanand in Vizag. Unfortunately, his next film, Vah re Vah, turned out to be a disaster. "That was a big mistake. But thanks to my last film Basanti, I managed to get noticed as a performer," explains Goutham's career seems nothing like his illustrious dad's. But Goutham is happy living in the shadow of his great father, who became the first actor to have acted in over 1,000 films. "My dad came from nowhere and did it all himself. He is a phenomenon, and I would be stupid to try and emulate what he did. But hopefully, I will make him proud one day. For now, I'm just focussed on being the best that I can be," he says, signing off.
News.Heading: Kannada actor Shivarajkumar suffers heart attack
News.text: Kannada actor Shivaraj Kumar, son of late matinee idol Dr Rajkumar has been hospitalised after he complained of a severe chest pain while working out at a gym on Tuesday. According to sources , the man had a history of high blood pressure and had a stressful job - factors that may have contributed to mild heart attack. The gym staff immediately shifted the actor hospital where he subjected to ECG and Angiogram. Hospital sources said they have found two blocks in the artery and doctors are yet to decide on whether they need to conduct angioplasty or an open heart surgery.
News.Heading: Convicts are making a comeback in Mollywood
News.text: Of late, Mollywood has been gripped by cop movies with several A-listers queuing up to don the khaki and boots. But it's not just the police that are making a comeback as movies with prisoners are in vogue too! From Mathilukal and Kaalapani to Anwar and Munnariyippu, Malayalam movies have used prisons effectively to shape dramatic tales. This year alone has four films with stars such as Dileep and Dulquer Salmaan playing convicts. Here's a list of movies that have our actors behind the bars: Welcome to Central Jail Dileep's upcoming release, directed by Sunderdas, has him playing a Good Samaritan of sorts who takes on the blame of others and willingly undergoes jail terms. Its scribe Benny P Nayarambalam says, "There are a lot of innocent people who get charged for cases because they were at the wrong place at the wrong time. This story is about a man who bails out such people. However, he doesn't cover for murders or rapes but petty cases that would get him a maximum of a six-month sentence." Kammattipadam Director Rajeev Ravi's movie chronicles the evolution of a gangster from a ghetto in Kochi. Dulquer plays the protagonist Krishnan and which gangster's life is complete without a stint behind the bars? The actor had shot in Trivandrum Central Jail for a few portions as the character's younger self in his lean avatar. From its latest trailer, it's clear that Krishnan is not the kind who quietly serves his jail term as we get to see him go toe-to-toe with the other inmates. Urumbukal Urangarilla The thriller had Vinay Forrt, Chemban Vinod, Aju Varghese, Mustafa and Kalabhavan Shajon as prisoners. The film had Vinay Forrt's character Manoj being trained under the tutelage of a master thief played by Chemban. The two eventually are apprehended and sent to jail. Once behind the bars, the duo along with other inmates hatches a plot to take revenge against another convict, who had murdered Manoj's family. Karinkunnam Sixes The movie, directed by Deepu Karunakaran, presents the prisoners of Trivandrum Central Jail in a different light. It has its protagonist Manju Warrier playing a volleyball coach who trains a group of prison inmates in the sport, instilling confidence and team spirit among them. The elaborate cast of prisoners include Sudev Nair, Babu Anthony and Jacob Gregory. Upcoming Indrajith-Biju Menon movie The Jeethu Joseph-scripted movie is based on its director Ansar Khan's State Award-winning telefilm Mukhamukham. Biju Menon and Indrajith play convicts who are being transported from Peermade to Ernakulam. "About 80 per cent of the film will be shot in the forest. The movie is primarily about the two prisoners and the entire story is weaved around their journey inside a forest," Jeethu told us.
News.Heading: Jaaved Jaaferi's Marathi rap song
News.text: The upcoming Marathi movie 'Youth' has been hitting the right notes, quite literally. A story about a group of youngsters, this film features Akshay Waghmare, Neha Mahajan and Meera Joshi among others. While the subject revolves around the things wrong in the society today and how they affect youngsters, it is the music of the film that's the talk of the town. Also read: Javed Jaffrey to explore his dark side Javed Jaffrey, who has been lauded for his comic timing on screen, is changing gears Javed Jaffrey: In touch with reality Javed Jaffrey, founder-chairman of Indian Documentary Foundation, is on a mission - to take non-fictional films to a wider audience The film's music album boasts of big names including Swanand Kirkire who has sung a bharood and Armaan Malik who's crooned the song 'Je hote mala'. Armaan Malik records 'Je hote mala': And Swanand sings a bharood: Another name that features in the singers' list is Jaaved Jaaferi . The actor-dancer-comedian, who is known for his perfect impersonations of various personalities and also for his comic timing, has recorded a rap song for the album. The song titled 'Band kar raag' speaks about the current political scenario and urges the Youth to bring about a change in it. Speaking about the same Jaaved said, "Conveying the political state-of-affairs to the youngsters is what prompted me to give a go-ahead to this song." News.Heading: Cannes 2016: Marathi presence at the French Riviera
News.text: Aishwarya Rai Bachchan's purple lipstick and Sonam Kapoor's dress at the red carpet sent the internet into a tizzy but away from the spotlight, representatives from the Marathi film industry too are making the most of their visit to the Cannes Film Festival. Here's a round-up of the Marathi presence at Cannes this year. Film screenings For any filmmaker, a screening at Cannes is like a dream come true and this time four Marathi films have paved their way to the prestigious film festival; Punarvasu Naik's Vakratunda Mahakaaya, Makarand Mane's Ringan (which was adjudged the Best Marathi film at the National Awards), Shivaji Lotan-Patil's Halal and Gajendra Ahire's The Silence. While Naik's film released last year, the other three are yet to get a theatrical release back home. Initially, only the first three were scheduled for screenings and The Silence, which is actress Anjali Patil's Marathi debut and also has director Nagraj Manjule in an important role, was on stand-by. Meeting and networking Apart from Ahire and other people associated with the films being screened at Cannes, some more cinema enthusiasts from the industry are also present at the festival. Actor and soon-to-be director Adinath Kothare, director Samit Kakkad, producers Suresh Jaisinghani and Vivek Kajaria are among those getting a feel of cinematic glory at the French Riviera. Adinath, who is there for a producers' workshop, recently met with Game of Thrones producer Bernadette Caulfield and Information and Broadcasting Minister Rajyavardhan Singh Rathore. Before leaving for Cannes, Adinath had told us, "I am going to get acquainted with world cinema; trends, business and reach. This will help me with my directorial debut Paani." The actor has been posting photos and videos of his experiences online quite actively. Samit, who is at Cannes for the second time, informed, "I think this is a great place for all filmmakers to network, show your film to buyers and close deals. I met some sales agents who are interested in the worldwide distribution of my upcoming film Half Ticket and we will close a deal soon." Bollywood connect Another Marathi name that features in the list is that of Amruta Subhash. The actress is at Cannes for the premiere of her upcoming Hindi film Raman Raghav 2.0. The Anurag Kashyap film, featuring Nawazuddin Siddiqui, has earned favourable reviews at the festival. While Amruta's connection with Anurag is for a Hindi film, the latter is connected to Vakratunda Mahakaaya as a producer. WATCH: Aishwarya and Blake Lively at Cannes:
News.Heading: We love handspun fabrics, say the P3Ps of Hyderabad
News.text: At a recent exhibiton held at an upmarket city hotel on Thursday morning, the swish set came down to check what the local artisans had in store for them. Manolya Onur, was also spotted at a public gathering after quite a while . The P3Ps, looked mighty engrossed in shopping and were heard discussing the beauty of the hand-woven fabrics during the high-tea post the exhibition.
News.Heading: Music in Gujarati films a largely untapped market: Parthiv Gohil
News.text: Famous Gujarati singer Parthiv Gohil, who has worked on prestigious Bollywood projects like Saawariya and Devdas, has been working on quite a few Gujarati films of late and feels that music in Gujarati films remains a largely unexplored territory. Says Parthiv, "I feel that music in Gujarati films remains a largely untapped market and there is a lot that remains to be explored. In many ways, the musical success of Kevi Rite Jaish was a turning point of sorts and it was really encouraging for the industry. I have been recording for quite a few Gujarati films, and I think the scenario is changing for the better. Makers of Gujarati films are exploring new subjects and even composers are taking up new challenges, which is heartening
News.Heading: Mithun Chakraborty surrenders Rs 1.2cr received from Saradha to ED
News.text: KOLKATA: Trinamool Congress MP and actor Mithun Chakraborty on Tuesday surrendered to Enforcement Directorate (ED) an amount of about Rs 1.2 crore that he had received from scam-hit Saradha group of companies for being its brand ambassador. Sources said a team of lawyers and other representatives of the actor reached the probe agency's office at Salt Lake here and handed over a Demand Draft (DD) to the investigating officer (IO) of the case. "This was part of Chakraborty's earlier commitment that he would return the funds that he had received from the group. The DD has been given to the IO of the Saradha scam probe case," sources said. READ ALSO: Saradha scam: ED issues fresh summons to Mithun Chakraborty They added that the agency is satisfied with the said action and the statement recorded by the actor-politician regarding his role in the operations of the group, which has now become defunct in the wake of allegations against it of perpetrating a large-scale chit-fund scam in West Bengal and other states. During his last questioning by ED here in May, Chakraborty had provided the agency sleuths with a number of DVDs, CDs and scripts that he had got as part of being the brand ambassador of the Saradha group. The actor had done so to back his claim to investigators that his association with Saradha Group was "purely professional" and that he had no intentions of cheating or duping anyone. "He had told investigators that he had no inkling about any sort of scam that was being perpetrated. The actor had submitted all his personal and official records to the agency in this regard," the sources said. Chakraborty had also promised he would deposit the amount of Rs 1.2 crore he had received from Saradha Group so that it may be finally restored to the depositors who were allegedly cheated in the scam. The Rajya Sabha MP of the ruling party in West Bengal had told ED that he "actually acted in promotional videos and advertisements that were broadcast on television shows" made by the Saradha Group and that was done as per his contract. He told investigators that if he had bad intentions, he would not have undertaken the promotional activity and instead merely stashed the money away. The probe agency had in June last year questioned the actor in Mumbai after it detected that some money had gone into his account from Saradha business portals. ED subsequently summoned him again early this year following which the latest submissions happened. While recording his statement last year, sources said Chakraborty had told investigators that he had "no business dealings" with the now-defunct group which was headed by Sudipta Sen and that he would share all personal transaction details with them. ED sources had earlier said Chakraborty was reportedly sent the said amount for being the brand ambassador of a media platform floated by Saradha Group. The agency had registered a criminal case under PMLA in 2013 and has already questioned a number of people, including sitting MPs and political leaders, in this regard. The agency, till now, has found that a maze of 338 bank accounts and 224 companies were used by the perpetrators of the alleged ponzi scam which duped investors in various states including West Bengal, Odisha and Assam. CBI, probing the case on the directions of Supreme Court, has also filed a chargesheet in a court.
News.Heading: I had a good time in Vadodara: Vijender Singh
News.text: The team of the film 'Fugly', which will hit the screens soon, was recently in Vadodara for a promotional trip and India's Olympic medal winning boxer Vijender Singh,who is making his Bollywood debut with this film, says that he had a great time. Says Vijender, "It is always good to come to Gujarat. Gujaratis are wonderful people and I love the language too, which is very sweet. I was impressed by the facilities at the city-based Gold's Gym and also had a fun experience at the Parul Institute. Overall, I really enjoyed my Vadodara trip."
News.Heading: Madras high court stays release of Vikram-starrer 'I'
News.text: CHENNAI: The Madras high court on Thursday stayed the release of multi-crore film 'I', dealing a big blow to Tamil film industry which is still to recover from the commercial failure of Rajinikanth-starrer 'Lingaa'. 'I', featuring Vikram and Amy Jackson and directed by Shankar, was scheduled for release on the Pongal day, January 15. Justice R Mahadevan granted the interim injunction, restraining Aascar Films Private Limited, its directors V Ravichandran and D Ramesh Babu, besides Reliance Mediaworks Ltd, from releasing the film till January 30. The producers, distributors, film laboratories and digital projection services are "hereby restrained by an order of interim injunction till January 30, 2015 from releasing the movie in theatres all over the country, and in any country outside India. In the meanwhile, applicant (Picutrehouse) is directed to initiate arbitration proceedings," the judge said. The judge was passing orders on an application filed by Picturehouse Media Limited, Chetpet, claiming non-performance of commercial and financial agreements between it and Aascar Films. It wanted the matter to be settled by arbitration. While restraining all concerned from releasing the film in any format till January 30, Justice Mahadevan asked the litigating parties to settle the issue by arbitration in the meanwhile. He issued notices to the producers and directed them to file their response by then.
News.Heading: Pawan Kalyan returns as 'Sardaar Gabbar Singh'
News.text: Telugu superstar Pawan Kalyan is set to enthrall viewers with 'Sardaar Gabbar Singh'. Helmed by KS Ravindra, the action-packed entertainer will release in Hindi and Telugu next month. The film, which is a sequel of the 2012 hit 'Gabbar Singh,' sees Pawan play a cop and pair up with Kajal Aggarwal for the first time. Its teaser that was launched last week has got a good response online. Sunil Lulla, MD, Eros International, which is releasing the Hindi version, says, "This highly stylised action-packed film, starring one of our biggest stars, promises universal appeal that will resonate with the audience in Northern markets as well." The actor adds, "We've attempted to make a film that will have a unique connect with India, especially the Hindi belt." Producer Sharrath Marar sums it up, "There are huge expectations from Tollywood's most anticipated movie and we are confident this will charm Pawan Kalyan's fans and win hearts across the country as well." 'Sardaar Gabbar Singh,' released by Eros International in association with Pawan Kalyan Creative Works and Northstar Entertainment, releases on April 8.
News.Heading: A perfect sundowner to end the weekend in Hyderabad
News.text: Those Hyderabadis who love their deep house and trance could not have found a better way to bid aideu to their weekend. The city played host to a sundowner featuring electronic music artistes like Darlyn Vlys whose music is a fusion of French and Spanish influences. As Darlyn spun his tunes, the crowd shot back at him with loud cheers. A special cocktail did the rounds which the guests enjoyed.
News.Heading: 'We had to store water for the entire week'
News.text: Actress and model Ketaki Narayan reminisced about how water scarcity shadowed her childhood in her hometown Akola. Ketaki is featuring in upcoming Marathi film 'Youth' which talks about six youngsters and how they fight to get water for villagers. While taking about the film she said, "I am portraying a character of very sensitive girl. This film made me recall the severe water scarcity we faced in my childhood. I come from Vidarbha and I know how hard it is to get even a single bucket of water." Ketaki has even fetched water from tanker. "I remember, I was very young, yet I used to get water from tanker in a small bucket. We had to store water for the entire week once the tanker used to arrive. Today, I am happy that I am part of a film which talks about water scarcity and the problem our villages are facing today," she further adds. Many big names are associated with the movie including Vikram Gokhale, Javed Jaffrey and Swanand Kirkire. Javed has sung a rap song for the movie whereas a Bharud pictured on Sayaji Shinde and sung by Swanand Kirkire is attracting listeners. Even Armaan Malik has crooned a song for the film. The film also features Neha Mahajan of 'Coffee ani Barch Kahi' fame. Akshay Mhatre, Meera Joshi and Akshay Waghmare are also part of the film. WATCH: Trailer of 'Youth':
News.Heading: Allari Naresh gets married to Virupa
News.text: Allari Naresh tied the knot with Chennai-based architect Virupa at 10 pm on Friday night, amidst beats of mridangam and nadaswaram. Post the thaali kattu ceremony, it was all fun and games, as the newlyweds were seen in their element during the 'talambralu', even as friends and family cheered them on. And almost four hours later, in the post-nupital ceremony where the bride and the groom vie with each other to retrieve a ring dropped in a pot, Allari Naresh had the last laugh. "Both of them played the game very seriously. While Naresh won the first two rounds, Virupa got the ring in the final round... We had so much fun cheering for them," said actor Nani's wife, Anjana, who's a close friend of Naresh. "It's truly a match made in heaven..." "The couple just can't stop blushing..." "They look very much in love..." "They look perfect for each other..." these were just some of the comments overheard as Naresh and Virupa posed for pictures, took selfies with their friends and greeted their guests. The ceremony came to an end around midnight, soon after Allari Naresh took Virupa outside to show her the 'Arundhati nakshatram'. When Chandrababu Naidu stopped the show, literally... An hour into the ceremony, when Andhra CM, Nara Chandrababu Naidu walked in, along with son Lokesh, the rituals at the mandap had to be paused for few moments to felicitate a quick photo session with the couple. By then, both Naresh and Virupa were seated on either side of the curtain that separates the groom and the bride until the muhurtam; however, the couple made an exception for the chief minister and got up from their seats. And as soon as Chandrababu Naidu left the stage, the rituals proceeded without any further interruption. Later, CBN was seen spending some time mingling with guests at the venue, during which Naresh's elder brother Rajesh introduced his son, Aarav to him. The usually reticent CBN, who's just become a grandfather himself, seemed to be in an indulgent mood as he interacted with the tots who gathered around him. Cell phone-wielding young fans kept celebs on their toes Almost all the celebrities who graced the ceremony were kept busy by kids and youngsters who flocked to them for selfies. As long as there were no bodyguards around, the kids didn't let even a single celebrity go without posing for a selfie! From the wedding hall, to the mandap and even the food counters outside the young uns were everywhere, ready with their phone cameras and selfie faces!
News.Heading: Veteran Gujarati actress Padmarani passes away
News.text: Gujarati actress, stage artist and sister of popular actress, Sarita Joshi, Padmarani, passed away at a private hospital in Mumbai today, 25 January 2016. Incidentally, today also happens to be her 79th birth anniversary. Padmarani was admitted to Wockhardt Hospital in Mumbai following complications in her lungs caused by a viral fever. Padmarani was born to a Marathi family in Pune and spent most of her adulthood in Vadodara. The veteran actor acted in a series of Gujarati films and went on to act in some Bollywood movies too. Some of the popular plays in which she was the lead are 'Baa Retire Thai Chhe,' 'Baa A Maari Boundary,' 'Kevda Na Dankh,' 'Saptapadi,' 'Chandarwo,' '5 Star Aunty,' 'Vachan,' among others. She has also acted in several renowned Hindi movies including Parivar (1968), Veer Ghatotkach (1970), Jai Santoshi Maa (1975), Dil (1990) as Aamir Khan's mother and Zaalim (1994). News.Heading: Bhoomi, Samir, Mana bond over music
News.text: When an exceptionally good singer meets with two brillaintly talented musicians, you know it is bound to lead to some musical fireworks. Recently, Bhoomi Trivedi, who is currently recording a lot of songs for Samir-Mana for a couple of different films, was in their studio, recording for a movie titled Matsar. But their bond is so special that not only did she record the song, the three of them also bonded over a cool jam session for hours. Says Mana Raval, "We have worked with Bhoomi on a lot of projects in the recent past and so it has become very easy for us to bond over music. She's a wonderful girl. We were all a little free after the recording got done surprisingly fast and so went on to do a little singing and music session."
News.Heading: Kishore roped in for Kamal Haasans next
News.text: Kishore, who was last seen in the Tamil film Thilagar, has been roped in for Kamal Haasan's next, Thoongavanam. Confirming this, the actor told us, "I have a key role in the movie and my character will be introduced in the beginning itself. I can't reveal much about my role as it is being kept secret." Apart from Kamal, the action-thriller also has Trisha and Prakash Raj in prominent roles. Kishore is looking forward to working with Kamal, who he thinks is a "meticulous actor". "He comes with loads of experience and there is no one like him. I was just a spectator during the discussions that we had about the movie," he says. Kishore is currently busy shooting for Tund Haikal Sahavasa and is expected to join the cast of Thoongavanam in Hyderabad soon. He will shoot for the Tamil movie for the next two months.
News.Heading: Bas Ek Chance is an urban Gujarati film: Kirtan Patel
News.text: Well begun, they say, is half the job done. Vadodara boy Kirtan Patel, who will start shooting for his first Dhollywood film titled 'Bas Ek Chance' soon, has already put together an impressive cast (including the likes of veteran actors Rajeev Mehta and Falguni Dave) and says that his story will appeal to the audience. Kirtan shares, "Ours is a very urban film, which everyone will relate to. It is the story of an aspiring filmmaker, who overcomes many struggles in life and eventually achieves his dream. It's time that we told relevant stories in Gujarati films and I firmly believe that Gujarati films are changing for the better." The film, which will be shot in and around Vadodara, has Bhakti Kubavat and Aditya Kapadia in lead roles.
News.Heading: Simhaa will be seen in an action avatar in his next
News.text: Although Bobby Simhaa already has a slew of films like Urumeen, Paambu Sattai, Masala Padam, Bangalore Days remake and Ko2 underway, the actor has signed his next film. We hear that the actor will be teaming up with debutant director Vijay Vaanan for an out-and-out action film. A source close to the actor says, "Simhaa will be seen in an action avatar in this upcoming film. After Jigarthanda, he has been getting a lot of offers similar to the role of Sethu, that he had played in the film. But, he was not too keen on taking them up as he wanted to work on different genres. Now, after working on an interesting line up of films like Urumeen and the Bangalore Days remake, he has decided to take up this action film. He will start shooting for this yet-to-be-titled film from September."
News.Heading: Luxury car's magical March in Gujarat
News.text: Good services bring in great response. And this is exactly what happened with Nixynova Motoren Pvt. Ltd., the dealers for the luxury car brand Audi in Gujarat (they have dealership at Ahmedabad, Vadodara, Surat and Rajkot), who witnessed a groundbreaking response from their patrons bringing more smiles to their team. They couldn't have asked for a better gift from their patrons before ushering in the new financial year as they had record-breaking sales figures this March and registered a growth of more than 78% as compared to last year. This amazing success story hardly comes as a surprise though. After all, Audi has emerged as one of the most powerful, trusted and accepted brands in the state in the luxury car segment. Audi has always been the pioneers when it comes to introducing new technology and their great innovations and much sought-after products have always mesmerized their audience. The all new Audi Q7 and the Audi A6 Matrix were the big tickets that helped in ensuring a stellar performance. Speaking to us on this joyous occasion, Jainit Mistry, Director Sales and Marketing, Nixynova Motoren Pvt. Ltd., said, "We at Audi are very happy to retain our position in the luxury car market. This demonstrates the strength of brand Audi in the market. The audience today is amplified by younger participants with an interest in sport and exotic cars." So, it's time for some real celebrations.
News.Heading: 'Chandi Kori' team all geared up for 100 days bash on Jan 4
News.text: Bolli Movies' Tulu film 'Chandi Kori' that broke-even in 52 days of its release clocked its 100th day on January 2. Enthused by people's continued patronage to his film, director-actor Devdas Kapikad and the entire Bolli Movies team is all set to celebrate this occasion, that a handful of the 60-odd Tulu films released to date have achieved, with a bash scheduled to be held at Town Hall on Monday. All stakeholders of the film will be honoured on this occasion. Devdas told reporters here that the film has been running successfully in Kalpana theatre in Udupi, Suchitra talkies and Big Cinemas in the city for the past 100-days. "Suchitra theatre has been lucky for the production team in that it has helped buck a trend for Tulu films that only those Tulu films released at Jyothi theatre rake in the moolah," he said, adding that the box office at Suchitra had returned record breaking collection thus far with average daily collection of Rs 1 lakh. The film running for 100-days in Kalpana too is a record in that it is the first Tulu film to do so for any theatre in Udupi, he said, adding that Chandrashekar Holla, the exhibitor has confirmed that 68,000 patrons have watched the film in the last 100-days there. "'Chandi Kori' has broken the collection that hit Kannada films such as Mungaru Male and Yajamana brought for Kalpana," he said adding these are good, encouraging signs for the fledgling Tulu film industry. With the film attracting viewers in steady numbers at Big Cinemas even now, 'Chandi Kori' even achieved a record of touching 50-days in a suburban theatre Nataraj at Surathkal, he said. "No Kannada film has achieved this feat in Surathkal," he said adding even though Mangaluru is just 30-minute drive away, people in and around Surathkal have patronized the film in large numbers. This has spurred Bolli Movies to plan its next venture Barsa on a bigger scale, he noted. Incidentally, 'Chandi Kori' has not just been Tulu speaking districts phenomenon. Buttressing this, Devdas said, "A recent screening of the film in London attracted 175 viewers and plans are afoot to organize a second one for those who missed it." Film has been screened in Kuwait, Bahrain, and plans afoot to do so in Dubai, Qatar, Muscat and Australia. Film has done well even in Mumbai despite the limited screens available due to the Marathi first policy there, he said.
