News.Heading: After Aamir, Irrfan praises Sairat
News.text: Along with raking in the moolah, Nagraj Manjule's 'Sairat' has become the talk of Bollywood biggies. The film, a love story with a background of caste discrimination, has become the highest grossing Marathi film and everyone from Subhash Ghai to Aamir Khan is raving about it. 'Sairat' has also earned good reviews from critics. A few days ago, Aamir tweeted his feelings after watching the film and urged his followers to watch it too. Read: Aamir Khan praises Sairat Sairat movie review After Aamir, its the turn of Irrfan to praise the movie. In a recent tweet, the 'Madaari' actor congratulated Nagraj. Nagraj has become the poster boy of Marathi films and we wish his success for his future projects. more power to you Nagraj!
News.Heading: I am a clown in real life: Ashwin Kumar
News.text: Those who watched Nivin Pauly-starrer Jacobinte Swargarajyam would have noticed a new face among the lead stars, the deep-voiced, formidable looking businessman named Murali Menon who poses a threat to the family in the film. The actor who played the role, Ashwin Kumar, is a well-known mimicry artiste and short film actor, and this is his first role in a full-fledged feature film. Interestingly, Ashwin too is a Dubai-based businessman in real life but he says he is nothing like Murali Menon. "I'm a clown actually, my parents often ask me to start getting serious about life." But this young man is quite serious about cinema, and says the role in Jacobinte Swargarajyam was a dream-come-true for him. "I have to thank director Vineeth Sreenivasan for that, for casting a debutant like me for the character. It was meant to be done by none other than Gautham Menon." So how did he bag the role? "Well, destiny and luck, I would say," says Ashwin. "I was supposed to do just a small role, and I was about to fly to India to attend a very close friend's wedding. At that point, Vineethettan told me, 'Gautham Menon won't be able to come to Dubai as all flights from Chennai are cancelled due to the floods'. I felt bad as I wouldn't be able to meet Gautham, but was wondering why Vineeth was telling me all this. And then he just told me, 'I want you to do the role'. I went numb for a moment," he recalls. "I was in two minds as I couldn't miss my friend's wedding but then, it was Vineeth Sreenivasan who was inviting me. Later that day I found that my flight too had been cancelled owing to the floods. So I won't say I thank the Chennai floods as it was a very unfortunate disaster but it did play a part in my career." Watching Ashwin on screen, one wouldn't think he is a debutant, but the youngster says his experience in short films and stage performances have definitely helped. "I have been acting in short films for seven years and have even directed one. I had no contacts in films, and was in Dubai. All I had was my friends who always encouraged me." What with his mimicry skills, would he do comedy next? "I would love to! But I don't believe in branding roles, all I want to do is situational roles; how people are like in real life." So what is he planning on next? "I'm the heir to the throne to my dad's business; it's our bread and butter, and I have to be here in Dubai. But I hope to strike a decent balance between business and cinema."
News.Heading: Hogi Pyar Ki Jeet goes on floors
News.text: The shoot of Khesari Lal Yadav's upcoming film Hogi Pyar Ki Jeet is currently underway in full swing in Uttar Pradesh's Jaunpur. A major part of the shoot is taking place in and around a famous fort in the city. The film also stars Sweety Chhabda, Avadesh Mishra, Brijesh Tripathi, Anoop Arora, Neha Singh, Pallavi Kohli, Ayaz Khan and others. Hogi Pyar Ki Jeet is produced by Rahul Kapoor, whose recent film Katta Tanal Dupatta Par became a box office success. The film is said to be a family oriented love story. Yadav has also lent his voice for a song in the film. Well-known and veteran Bollywood singer Udit Narayan is also one of the playback singers. Apart from this film, Yadav is also shooting for director Manjul Thakur's yet untitled movie. Source: Bhojpurimedia.com
News.Heading: My entire life revolves around my mom: Tanvi Vyas
News.text: Vadodara girl Tanvi Vyas, who made Gujarat proud by winning the Femina Miss India Earth crown in 2008 and whose recent Telugu film Nenem Chinnapillana got very good reviews, says that she is completely dependent on her mom for almost everything. Shares Tanvi, "I really don't know how to manage things when my mother isn't around, and my entire life revolves around her. I share a great bond with her." Tanvi, who had a good 2013, is eagerly looking forward to a great 2014 too. She says, "2013 was an amazing year, as I got to do something new and exciting almost every month! I hope that things get even better this year."
News.Heading: The only way to survive in this industry is to want to be in it badly
News.text: For someone who shifted from doing a Bachelor's degree in science to doing a Masters in Drama, Shaunak's risk taking abilities are commendable. After doing some plays for college fests he has now acted in many plays including popular hit 'Preet Piyu Ne Panetar' and has also written and directed a number of plays. Shaunak found his calling as a theater artiste in college and made the decision to make his passion into his fulltime profession. "Initially it was slightly confusing, but when I realized that if I don't take this step now, I'd be working as a medical representative somewhere, collecting my salary and going home. Theater gave me a platform and made me a known face, I was not just making money but was also becoming famous. Had I been an MR, I'd never have done something I loved. Right then, the decision became easy." So what about the limited finances that Gujarati theater is known to have? "You must believe in yourself and the power of theater, you should be able to believe that doing plays will get you where you want to be, you will earn money and drive a car and live in a big house. To be able to survive in this industry, you should want to be in it badly. That's the only way I know."
News.Heading: Tamil actor Krishna booked under charges of dowry and harassment
News.text: Tamil cinema actor Krishna has been booked under dowry harassment case by all women police station, Thudiyalur here on Thursday. His wife Hemalatha of Mettupalayam claimed that her husband mistreated, manhandled her. Meanwhile, the actor filed a petition before Madras high court, seeking anticipatory bail. READ: ?'Paayum Puli' release stalled Hemalatha told in her complaint that she befriended the actor on Facebook. Later, they fell in love and got married. On February 6, 2014 the marriage was held at Sri Sai Mahal at Mettupalayam. His family members demanded 300 sovereigns of gold ornaments as dowry. But her family members gave 118 sovereigns and told them that they would provide the rest of the sovereigns later. The couple was living in an apartment at Ashoka avenue at Kodambakkam and later the couple was moved to T Nagar. Hemalatha said that she pursued BE (computer science) and was working for a software firm in Chennai. Initially, Krishna bought her a car to commute to her office while later she was asked to travel in bus. Krishna and his parents Sekar alias Kula Senate, film producer and Madhubala allegedly renewed the demand for 300 sovereigns of gold. But her family was unable to fulfill the demand. Hemalatha reported in her complaint that Krishna has extramarital affairs with a few women. She came to know about them and questioned him. Immediately, she was beaten by Krishna, for which she was later admitted to Malar hospital. Meanwhile, Krishna filed a case for divorce in July 2015. The police received the petition and forwarded it to Social welfare department as the petitioner mentioned that she was harassed in the pretext of dowry. Following the petition, Krishna was asked to appear before the officials of social welfare department and police. But he failed to appear and the police inspector Amudha registered a case against Krishna and his parents on Thursday under sections 498(A), 406, 506(i) of IPC and 4 of dowry prohibition act. WATCH: Dowry harassment case against Actor Krishna
News.Heading: Prithviraj to shoot Priyadarshans movie next year
News.text: That Prithviraj and Priyadarshan have teamed up for a movie is by itself a big news that Mollywood audience have longed to hear. We have now got wind of the details that the film, scripted by '1983' scribe Bipin Chandran, will go on floors by next year. Actor Manianpilla Raju, who is part of the film, says, "Priyadarshan had bounced off an idea to Prithviraj and he loved it. They are yet to develop the story as Priyadarshan also has another schedule of 'Oppam' with Mohanlal left. Right after that, he would be doing a Bollywood movie with Akshay Kumar." Raju, who will also be funding the film, says that the film will have a schedule in Sri Lanka. "The plan right now is to begin shooting the movie by January next year," says the actor. When we reached out to Priyadarshan, he said it is too soon to discuss the details of the movie as the script is yet to be completed. Meanwhile, Prithviraj is currently busy with the final schedule of Jeethu Joseph's revenge tale Oozham and will join the sets of debutant Jaykrishnan's 'Ezra' by the end of this month.
News.Heading: What are the collection figures of 10 Endrathukulla and Naanum Rowdy Dhaan?
News.text: Here's the buzz on the box office figures of the two Ayudha pooja releases 10 Endrathukulla and Naanum Rowdy Dhaan. Dhanush has tweeted the first-day collections of his production, the Vijay-Sethupathi-starrer Naanum Rowdy Dhaan. "Naanum Rowdy dhaan opens to a superb 2.16cr day 1 .Highest for Vijay Sethupathi. Expecting a big jump today," he tweeted and gave area-wise break-up of the collections. Meanwhile, there are two versions on the collections of Vikram's 10 Endrathukulla. While some trade analysts are saying that the film has collected to the tune of Rs 6.5 crore, making it the second highest opening day figures for a Vikram film after I, some others are maintaining that the film has collected only Rs 2.91 crores. Now, it is up to the production house behind the film to come out and clarify on the actual figures. But with the film earning mixed reviews, will they?
News.Heading: Plays need to be marketed better: Anupam Kher
News.text: Anupam Kher, who was in Vadodara recently for the play Kuchh Bhi Ho Sakta Hai, which was staged as a part of VadFest, feels that plays need to be promoted more aggressively in India, just as Bollywood films are. Said Kher, "More than anything else, it's the state of performing arts that best sums up any city and so, it's crucial that all of us support theatre as much as we can. Plays need to be marketed in a better way and it will certainly help if big actors, who go out of their way to promote films, do the same for plays too."
News.Heading: Kamal Haasan's 'Indian' sequel on the cards!
News.text: Producer AM Rathnam says the sequel to critically acclaimed Tamil blockbuster 'Indian' is in the offing. He added that talks with filmmaker Shankar have been initiated, but it is still not sure when the project will go on the floors. "I recently met Shankar and discussed the possibility of a sequel to 'Indian'. Since he's busy with 'Enthiran 2', the project is unlikely to happen soon," said Rathnam. Shankar-directed 'Indian' featured Kamal Haasan in the title role. It was about a man who takes corruption head on. Asked if the sequel will feature Haasan in the lead, Rathnam said: "It's too early to talk about it." AM Rathnam also said he is planning to bag the theatrical version of Shankar's 'Enthiran 2' with superstar Rajinikanth.
News.Heading: Trailer of Yogaraj Bhat's Vaastu Prakara
News.text: Kannada film director Yogaraj Bhat is gearing up for the release of his next - Vaastu Prakara. The film stars Jaggesh, Rakshit Shetty and Parul Yadav among others, and is said to be quite the laugh riot. Being experimental as always, Yogaraj has released a trailer that includes a team of three plus one crazy people at a talk show introducing various aspects of the film in a rather weird way. Check out the trailer to see what we mean. Watch the trailer of Vaastu Prakara here.
News.Heading: Anoop Menon is a forest officer in 10 Kalpanakal
News.text: Anoop Menon, who plays an Army major in 'Kuttikalundu Sookshikkuka', is busy shooting for Don Max's directorial debut '10 Kalpanakal'. His role in the film, says the actor, is one of the toughest he has taken up. "I play a forest officer in the movie," the actor says. "After Cocktail and Traffic , it's the first time I am doing such a riveting thriller. At the same time, it's also a family drama as it talks about family values and our religious belief systems too. The film is much relevant to our time and addresses a pertinent issue." Ask him more about his role in the movie and the 'Vikramadityan' star says, "The focus is more on the father and husband he is than about his occupation. My character is a family man who lives in a sleepy hamlet near a forest. How he gets embroiled in a case forms the plot." Apart from Anoop, the film also has Meera Jasmine and Kaniha, both of whom have been missing from Mollywood for a while. "Meera plays a cop and hers is a major character in the movie," explains Anoop, adding that '10 Kalpanakal' is shot entirely in Idukki. Meanwhile, Anoop Menon's next release will be the sports drama 'Karinkunnam Sixes', which has him playing Manju Warrier's husband. The duo had previously acted together in G Marthandan's 'Pavada'.
News.Heading: Sairat becomes highest grossing Marathi film
News.text: The Marathi film 'Sairat' has continued its golden run into the third week and is breaking records on its way. The film which collected Rs 25.50 cr in the first week of its release, went on to shatter Marathi BO records with a whopping collection of Rs 41.11 cr at the end of 11 days, according to the entertainment website Bollywood Hungama. Also read: Aamir Khan praises 'Sairat' In doing this, the film has surpassed the earnings of 'Natsamrat', 'Lai Bhaari', 'Duniyadari' and 'Balak Palak'. An interesting aspect to note about this collection figure is that it is much more than many Bollywood big ticket releases this year including 'Rocky Handsome' and 'Jai Gangaajal'. Furthermore, this feat has been achieved by the film in much lesser number of screens. While the Bollywood releases were screened across India, 'Sairat' released across Maharashtra and at a few screens in neighbouring states. The film directed by Nagraj Manjule and featuring Akash Thosar as Parshya and Rinku Rajguru as Archi, has been earning rave reviews for its realistic portrayal of a love story and its BO collection has only added to its success. 'Sairat's run at the BO stands to continue for another week due to no Marathi releases. Next week will be a testing time for the film with the Aishwarya Rai Bachchan-Randeep Hooda starrer 'Sarbjit' scheduled to hit screens. WATCH: 'Yad Lagla' from 'Sairat':
News.Heading: 'Captain America: Civil War' gets good start in India
News.text: New Delhi: The superhero team up in "Captain America: Civil War" has struck the right chord at the Indian box office. The film, starring Chris Evans and Robert Downey Jr has minted over Rs.27 crore in its opening weekend. The Disney and Marvel superhero adventure released in India on May 6. According to a statement from the makers, "Captain America: Civil War" collected Rs.9.81 crore on Sunday with a growth of 10 percent over Saturday. The cumulative total so far is Rs.27.13 crore. The collection is on the basis of business of both English as well as Hindi version of "Captain America: Civil War", wherein Bollywood actor Varun Dhawan has voiced the character of Steve Rogers aka Captain America. Directed by Joe and Anthony Russo, the film sees an ideological showdown between Iron Man (played by Downey Jr) and Captain America (Evans) and is packed to the brim with other superheros. Trade guru Taran Adarsh who is impressed with the business of the film tweeted: "'CaptainAmerica: Civil War' Friday Rs 8.53 crore, Saturday Rs 8.79 crore, Sunday Rs 9.81 crore... Total Rs. 27.13 crore nett...Excellent". "Captain America: Civil War" promises the spectacle of watching Captain America square off against Iron Man. It also introduces Tom Holland as Spider-Man and marks the first appearance of Chadwick Boseman as the Black Panther.
News.Heading: Jayasurya and Kunchacko Boban are at odds again!
News.text: After 'Gulumaal', both Jayasurya and Kunchacko Boban are once again at odds with each other in another Y V Rajesh script. In the upcoming Boban Samuel directorial Shajahanum Pareekuttyum, the duo's characters go all out to woo a girl played by Amala Paul. "In tune with its title, it's about two different perspectives of love with our characters being diametrically opposite," says Kunchacko Boban. "I play Pranav, a sophisticated high flying businessman while Jayan's character is a street-level goon. The movie is about how these two profess their love for the girl in their unique ways." About his character, Jayasurya elaborates, "His name is Prince and he's someone who is not bothered to stoop to any level to get a job done. His part in the story is that he's in search of his lost love." The movie is a full-on entertainer, says Jayasurya. "It's that kind of film where you have to leave your brains outside the theatre. The movie is packed with laugh-out-loud moments," he explains. Incidentally, it's the second consecutive movie for the duo the previous one being Rosshan Anddrews' School Bus , which is a serious movie. "We play entirely different characters in School Bus. We are not friends in the movie and so we had to be in that frame of mind while shooting for it," Jayasurya says, adding that he plays Joseph, a dad of two children. For Kunchacko Boban too, School Bus has been a novel experience. "I play a cop for the first time in my career. My character R Gopakumar is not a flashy police officer who throws punches and punch dialogues at will but a very realistic character that people can relate to," says the actor.
News.Heading: Shubra Aiyappa at a cocktail party at Sheraton Grand in Bengaluru
News.text: Bengaluru's swish set got to check out interesting fashion over canapes and special concoctions at a cocktail party organized by Jyotiee Balani, beverage enthusiast and food writer co-hosted by Sheraton Grand Bangalore Hotel at Brigade Gateway at their lounge Durbar. Spotted at the event were actresses Shubra Aiyappa and Tina Ponnappa, along with some of the party regulars.
News.Heading: Indian dance forms should be given enough encouragement: Shital Shah
News.text: Recently on the eve of International Dance day, actress Shital Shah , shared that while the international dance forms are getting a lot of attention, Indian dance forms are somewhere dissolving on this huge canvas. The actress said, "It's good that we are opening to many International dance forms, but we must also give our Indian dance forms that much importance and keep it alive." She further added, "There are mainly two reasons, why one can see this decline are because of two reasons. Firstly, with so many reality shows springing up and a vast exposure to various dance forms through internet and social media , there's a huge demand for these dance forms. Also I believe that there aren't enough takers for the Indian classical dance forms, and hence one can see this decline." READ ALSO: 10 things you should know about Shital Shah
News.Heading: Siddharth continues relief work in Cuddalore
News.text: Actor Siddharth and RJ Balaji have been doing some active relief work from the time the floods struck in Chennai and ravaged the city. While RJ Balaji continues to help the victims in the city of Chennai, actor Siddharth has gone to Cuddalore today to help the affected people there. Cuddalore is another coastal town that has been badly hit by the rains and people in the town are in dire straits. Balaji posted on his micro-blogging page, "It is not bout @Actor_Siddharth and me anymore. We just did a small bit n we will continue to do that. Now, u got to make this as ur movement."
News.Heading: Mollywood warms up to films with kids in key roles
News.text: With the schools closed for vacation, it seems that Mollywood has opened the doors for more movies with children playing the pivotal characters. Already three movies are under production with kids in central roles Kunchacko Boban's 'School Bus', an upcoming Sunny Wayn film and Tovino Thomas' 'Guppy'. The latest to join the bandwagon is Kalavoor Ravikumar's 'Kuttikalundu Sookshikuka'. While the movie has Anoop Menon and Bhavana as part of the cast, it's Jo and the Boy star Sanoop Santhosh and Balaganapathy fame Siddharth Ajithkumar who play the central roles. "Their characters set off the plot with a particular incident," Ravikumar says.However, he adds that it is not a children's movie. "While it has its series of fun and feel-good moments, it evolves into a thriller." Of late, Mollywood has had several such films that have schoolchildren as key characters in spite of having superstars such as Mammootty, Nayanthara and Manju Warrier as part of the cast. Here are some such movies: Jo and the Boy The movie was billed as a children's film starring Manju Warrier. But it turned out to be an inspirational film about not giving up on one's dreams, no matter one's age. Sanoop's character provides the inspiration for Manju to accomplish her dream of becoming a renowned animator. Malgudi Days The film was inspired by a real-life incident in Nagaland about two school children, played by Janaki Menon and Vishal Krishna, who get trapped in the school campus. The movie also has Anoop Menon and Bhamaa, but it was the two kids who made the maximum screen time with eight-year-old Janaki winning a State Award for her performance in the movie. Ben The Vipin Atley movie, which was based on true incidents, was about kids but was definitely not a children's film. It told the tale of a mom and son, and how unrealistic expectations take a toll on the child physically and mentally. While Anjali Upasana, who played the mother, won a State Award for her performance, Gaurav Menon as Ben clinched the National and State Awards for the Best Child Artiste. School Bus The film, based on real-life events, is scripted by Bobby-Sanjay duo and directed by Rosshan Andrrews. It also has Kunchacko Boban and Jayasurya as part of the cast. Despite the heavyweights, the movie is told from the point of view of two kids and through them, the audience gets a peek in to the adults' world. The film reportedly is about a child-missing case, which Kunchacko's cop character investigates. Bhaskar the Rascal The movie has two superstars of the South Mammootty and Nayanthara but it was two child artistes who played the key roles in bringing the lead characters together. The former plays a widower while Nayanthara essays an estranged wife. Their children are schoolmates and their friendship leads to their parents becoming close.' Jilebi The movie showcased the clash of lifestyles between Jayasurya's rustic character and his Dubai-bred nephews. The kids played the central role in the movie that emphasised on the fact that one should value relationships over a person's financial status. Guppy The film has Tovino Thomas playing a civil engineer who comes to town to supervise the construction of a bridge. However, the central character is a 14-year-old boy, who makes a living by rearing and selling aquarium fish. Sunny Wayn's upcoming movie The upcoming film has Deiva Thirumagal fame Sarah Arjun playing a six-year-old school kid named Ann Maria. Sunny Wayn will be seen as a rustic youth, who enters her life by accident. How the two influence each other's lives forms the plot of this feel-good movie.
News.Heading: Shivarajkumar's Belli cut by 13 minutes
News.time_cap: Bangalore Mirror Bureau | Nov 7, 2014, 12.06 PM IST
News.text: Shivarajkumar's latest release Belli will be trimmer by 13 minutes from today. The film released last week and was 140 minutes long. The Mussanje Mahesh directed film is now shorter after audience feedback that some of the scenes were not effective due to their length. It is not uncommon for films to be trimmed after release. However, they have to go through the process of getting permission from the Censor Board even for deleting any scene. Recently films like Ninnindale and Ulidavaru Kandante were trimmed after release. Ninnidale lost as much as 18 minutes while Ulidavaru Kandante lost 12 minutes. There were some some exchange of words between Ulidavaru Kandante director Rakshit Shetty and producer Suni with the former accusing of trimming the film without informing the former. But the real trouble was for the film Adyaksha. There were objections to a song in the film about Lord Krishna. The Censor Board, however, did not find anything wrong and allowed the song in full. However bowing to pressure from a caste group, a portion of the song was deleted.
News.Heading: Security heightened at Goa EDM festivals over terror threat
News.text: Security at the electronic dance music (EDM) festivals Sunburn and the Supersonic held annually in Goa, will be heightened in view of a terror threat posed by extremist groups like the Islamic State (IS), Tourism Minister Dilip Parulekar said. ?ALSO READ: Goa govt yet to give nod to 'Sunburn', 'Supersonic' festivals Speaking to IANS on the sidelines of a media event at the state Secretariat on Wednesday, Parulekar also said that permissions for the two events were held in abeyance, until the organisers complied with requests for providing additional security cover."We want the best security in view of the IS threat. The single window permission committee headed by the chief secretary, which grants permission for such events has decided to ask the organisers of the events to increase security on site," Parulekar said. Chief Secretary of Goa, R.K. Srivastava heads the committee which grants single window clearance to major tourism related events organised in the state. Parulekar also said that some of the specific requests which have been made by the committee includes increasing the number of metal detectors at the EDM festival venues and sniffer dogs to keep track of possible explosive substances. "The police will be there, but the organisers will also have to increase the security in view of the threat. The permissions will be granted once they comply with these conditions," Parulekar said. Goa, one of the top beach and nightlife tourism destinations, hosts two of the biggest party events in the country namely Sunburn and Supersonic EDM festival which are held in the last week of December, which coincides with peak tourism season.
News.Heading: Canadian Paula makes her Marathi debut
News.text: Over the past few months we have heard of Marathi filmmakers and actors making it big with international offers. Well, it is understood then that actors and filmmakers from the other side will be happy to be seen in Marathi films too. One such example is Paula McGlynn. Paula, who hails from Vancouver, Canada, will be making her debut in Marathi films with fashion photographer turned filmmaker Prashant Patil's 'Pindadaan'. We speak to her about her journey from Canada to Pune and her future plans. Excerpts from an interview: Why did you choose to make a debut in a Marathi film? I came to India three years ago with an aim to make a career in the film industry. 'Pindadaan' came to me through a friend's friend, who was casting for the film. He thought I would fit the role perfectly. This is how I selected my first film as a lead. For me, it has never been about the language. It has always been about the right character, project and working with the right people. I am immersed in Marathi culture owing to a strong friend's circle and business partners who are Maharashtrians. So, my debut in a Marathi film is obvious. What about your character Ana appealed to you? The first thing I liked about this project that it is a unique opportunity for a non-Indian to play a character with so much depth and importance in a regional film. Ana is a complex character. The message and soul of the film was intriguing and I wanted to explore this aspect of it. You have been actively involved in various aspects of film making. Did it help you perform better as an actor? I believe the most important aspect for an actor is to get in touch with the character. One needs to mould into the character and believe in it. Secondly, you have to trust your director and have faith in his sketch. Prashant and the team have been extremely helpful with all of this. Yes, understanding the nuances of filmmaking helps when it comes to lighting and other effects. How fluent are you with Marathi? My character Ana is from England who comes to stay in Maharashtra. She falls in love and becomes one with the land and culture. My friend Rinki helped me with the language. She literally coached me. The script was in Devnagari so I learnt to write and speak the language. Siddharth Chandekar and Manava Naik helped me with my lines and made me feel comfortable on sets. I insisted on learning the language so that I could get the emotions right. It took me a month to get my dialogues in place.
News.Heading: TR Sahwney Motors opens its seventh showroom in Ghaziabad
News.text: Friends, family and clients of the Sahwney brothers recently got together when TR Sahwney Motors opened its seventh showroom in Ghaziabad. T Hashimoto, executive director (marketing and sales) of Maruti Suzuki India Ltd and RS Kalsi, executive director (domestic sales and marketing) of Maruti Suzuki India Ltd were chief guests on the occasion, and participated in the formal lamp lighting, inaugurating the showroom. Addressing the gathering, Sanjiv Sahwney, the technical director of the company, highlighted the achievements of the group. Speaking on the occasion, CEO of the company, Rajiv Kumar Sahwney, said, "This is our first showroom in Ghaziabad. The overwhelming love and acceptance we received in Delhi has encouraged us to expand our network. Today we have opened three showrooms, one at Rajouri Garden, one at Badli in Delhi and one at Rajendra Nagar in Ghaziabad. We believe that building our clients' trust by adding value to our services has helped us maintain a lifelong relationship with them." Encouraged by the response, the company aims at opening more showrooms in NCR. -
News.Heading: Sairat director's wife to reopen divorce case
News.text: Just a couple of weeks post the release of 'Sairat', director Nagraj Manjule has been caught in the midst of a controversy. The filmmaker is currently the toast of the film industry post the smashing success of the recently released film, but an old legal case has come back to haunt him. According to sources, Nagraj's ex-wife Sunita is planning to reopen the lawsuit that led to their divorce a couple of years ago, with the hope of 'securing justice'. Speaking to us about the same, Sunita's cousin, Sagar Lashkare, informed, "They got married when he was in class XII and for 15 years, my sister was by his side through thick and thin. After turning director, Nagraj hardly ever visited his hometown and whenever he did, he never spoke to her." In 2012, a divorce suit was filed which came through in 2014, according to Lashkare. "Post the decision, he gave an amount of `6-7 lakh to us and had assured that he would give more as and when needed. That never happened. Today, he's a star director, earning in crores but not once did he think about ruining my sister's life. We don't want money or anything else. We only demand justice and that is why we want to reopen the case," added Lashkare. Akash Painter, a social worker from Pune, also tried to settle the matter amicably a few years ago. "When the lady came to us with her complaint, I called up Nagraj and asked him to meet me in Pune to sort out the matter. He agreed but never came. After that the matter went to court," said Painter. We tried contacting Nagraj but he wasn't available for comment till the time of going to press. (Inputs by Shashank.Sane@timesgroup.com) *This is an updated version of the story. News.Heading: Bhushan's fans fall prey to online pranksters
News.text: Film and television actor Bhushan Pradhan, known for his performances in 'Pinjara', 'Satrangi Re', 'Coffee Aani Barach Kahi' and 'Timepass', has fallen prey to online pranksters. Though the actor only maintains one Facebook profile, a couple of fake profiles by his name have also spurred up in the virtual world. His fans, believing the fake profiles to be a real one, has been following them since long. Imagine the surprise when the actor's phone didn't stop ringing on May 15. Bhushan was showered with birthday wishes and messages on that day and he didn't know how to react. Also read: Bhushan on a new mission "I kept telling people that either you are wishing me too early, or you are wishing me too late," Bhushan shared. "My birthday is November 25 and a fake profile on Facebook shows it as May 15. It also shows Solapur as my hometown and people keep on asking me about that. It's not true. My hometown is Pune," he further added. The actor also advised his fans not to believe in any rumour spread by such fake accounts. FIND OUT: Bhushan's fitness regime:
News.Heading: After Darshan, Urvashi Rautela picks Salman?
News.text: One of the stunning faces to enter Sandalwood this year was Urvashi Rautela. The actress debuted opposite Challenging Star Darshan in the Kannada film Mr Airavathaa. The Mumbai-based leggy lass, who also represented India this year at the Miss Universe pageant, has now returned from the US and was spotted on Saturday night at Bollywood superstar Salman Khan's 50th birthday bash. The actress, who is quite enthusiastic with her PR, has already sent across a picture of her with Salman clicked at the party to the media. News.Heading: Aaj Jane Ki Zid Na Karo staged in Vadodara
News.text: Acclaimed playwright Saumya Joshi, who has given Gujarat some of the best Gujarati plays in recent times, again showed Barodians why he is rated so highly. His latest play Aaj Jane Ki Zid Na Karo, which was staged at the C C Mehta auditorium in Vadodara, got a standing ovation from Barodians. Later, Saumya said that he would love to pack the Barodian audience wherever they travelled next! Jigna Vyas and Jayesh More, the lead actors, were outstanding and the play left everyone teary-eyed at places. The event was organized by Insync Club.
News.Heading: Sequels galore to storm Sandalwood screens
News.text: Be it thrillers, romance or drama, Sandalwood viewers are in for a treat, as there are quite a few sequels in the pipeline in Sandalwood. While some of these star the same actors as the originals, others have newer, younger faces in the sequels that are underway. This year already saw Uppi 2, the sequel to director-actor Upendra's earlier self-titled film, albeit with some new faces added to the cast. Among those underway, we have Mungaru Male 2, which has the same hero, but a different director and heroine. Ganesh romances newbie Neha Shetty, with Shashank directing the new film. The 2011 hit Rajdhani, which was one of the early hits in Yash's career, is having a sequel with an all-new cast. Hariprriya is the heroine, opposite Preetham as her hero. Director Suni is currently completing the sequel to his film Simplag Ondu Love Story, which has been titled Simplag Innondu Love Story. The film stars TV actor Praveen and Meghana Gaonkar in lead roles. Kalpana, which was a remake of the Tamil film Kanchana, will have a sequel too. While there was a Muni 3 that was made after Kanchana, we wonder if that will be the subject of Kalpana 2. Also currently in the works is director-actor Kishan's sequel to his C/O Footpath, titled Care of Footpath 2. The film, to be released in Hindi and Telugu as well, has an ensemble cast of many known faces and stars Bollywood director Anees Bazmee and actress Esha Deol. Other sequels that have been announced so far include Ayya 2, Huccha 2 and Dandupalya 2, which have been greenlit quite a while ago, but are still in different stages of production. Both the Ayya and Huccha sequels have younger heroes replacing the original cast. Chiranjeevi Sarja will be seen in Ayya 2, while Dhananjaya was roped in to be in Huccha 2. Among the newer ones that will go on floors, Suri's recently released Manvitha- and Vicky-starrer will have both a part 1 and part 2 releasing, given that the film that hit screens was a part 2 itself. The Sriimurali-starrer Ugramm will have a sequel titled Ugramm Veeram. Certain scenes in KM Chaitanya's Aatagara also suggest that it might have a sequel, but the makers haven't confirmed anything. There has been talk about a sequel to the Yash- and Kriti Kharbanda-starrer-Googly and the Ramya- and Srinagara Kitty-starrer Sanju Weds Geetha, but we haven't heard from the makers after initial speculation and discussions about the projects.
News.Heading: Trailer: Mr and Mrs Ramachari

News.Heading: Prayaga to play an 80s college girl
News.text: 'Pisasu' fame Prayaga Martin's debut Malayalam movie is yet to release, but the actress seems to be signing many interesting movies with various kinds of roles. In her next film titled 'Ore Mugham', directed by Sajan, she plays an 80s college girl. Prayaga says, "My character is named Bhama and she is a bold girl. She will be mostly seen in pattu pavada and blouse, and 80s style salwars. I have been taking extra efforts to portray my character to match the era. From accessories to the mannerisms of Bhama, the 80s style will be clearly showcased. Throughout the movie, I will also be sporting the popular hairstyles of the time." Considering that even the casual conversations of the 80s were quite different from that of today, she adds, "We are paying close attention to the words used, gestures and expressions, while enacting our characters." Ore Mugham has actors Dhyan, Aju, Deepak, Arjun, Gayatri and Prayaga in important roles and they will be seen as college mates in the movie. The actress also has Pa.Va and Oru Murai Vanthu Parthaya coming up.
News.Heading: Hyderabad gets a taste of Subramaniam gharana
News.text: All roads led to Shilpakala Vedika on Thursday. You might be sniggering at that cliche but that was the reality, so much that choc-a-block traffic even got the performing artistes of the Times of India Lakshminarayana Global Music Festival a bit delayed. Nevertheless, once the music began all pressures of the outside world were laid to rest as Dr L Subramaniam picked up his bow to play violin and conduct the amalgamation of the seven percussionists from across the country. In the first half of the show, the women of the family took the stage. Bindu's Let there be love and peace... a perfect balm for today's fractured world was followed by Kavita Krishnamurti's, who took to stage amid applause and prayed for musical avenues beyond movies in her life as she sang a bhajan. However, she did perform her iconic film numbers from 1941, a Love Story and Bombay. Then arrived the father and son duo (Dr L Subramaniam and Ambi), who performed in beautiful symphony a composition made to commemorate the 40 years of Indian Independence and performed at the United Nations, New York. But the audiences who were already in the trance had no idea what was going to come their way in the second half, following a small break. What followed next was a energetic second half that began with electrifying guitars for the track Time is right and then the highlight of the evening the percussion symphony. "We are first going to try it on you and see your reaction and decide if we want to play it in other cities," quipped Dr Subramaniam, who walked up and down the stage at complete ease as if the violin was a natural extension of his body and soul. Of course, the mesmerising symphony was received with loud applause Hyderabad had not just liked it but loved it. The final piece had everyone from the Subramaniam family on stage Kavita, Bindu, Ambi and even Dr Sumbramaniam's three-and-half-year-old granddaughter Mahati, who was welcomed on the stage with "awwwws" from the audience. As they sang, together and Subramaniam involved the percussionists on the stage in a playful juglabandi, one could picturise an average day in the Subramaniam household being full of beautiful music and symphony. After taking out time to talk to his fans at the end of the show, Dr Subramaniam, elated by Hyderabad's response, says, "Yea, most people jokingly say we are the Subramaniam gharana." And Hyderabad sure loved being part of the family.

News.Heading: Mamta to play a medical student in Thoppil Joppan
News.text: Several names have been doing the rounds to play the second heroine in Mammootty's 'Thoppil Joppan'. The team has now finally zeroed in on their actress with Mamta Mohandas signing on the dotted line. "She will play Maria, a medical student," says the movie's scribe Nishad Koya. Most of the story of the Johny Anthony's directorial evolves in the village Thopramkudy, Idukki, he explains. "Maria comes to the village as part of a medical camp. There's a mystery about her character that we don't want to reveal right now." Incidentally, the last time Mammootty and Mamta teamed up for a film was for Ranjith Sankar's 'Varsham', in which she played a doctor. The upcoming movie will mark Mamta's first project after 'Two Countries' late last year. The actress has also signed up for Rajeev Nath's 'Babysitters', which is set to begin filming by June in Washington DC. Mamta and Biju Menon play a couple in the film. Meanwhile, 'Thoppil Joppan' also has Andrea Jeremiah as the other female lead. "She plays Annie, who is Mammootty's love interest in the movie," Nishad explains, adding that Mammootty's character Joppan is an alcoholic. "Mammukka's character Joppan turns to alcohol to overcome a love failure. He hangs around with his four buddies most of the day. His other interest is Kabaddi and he is the captain of a team aptly named Cheers." The team, has currently wrapped up its Kottayam schedule, and will head to Wagamon, Pala and Thoduppuzha in the coming weeks.
News.Heading: Bobbi Kristina Brown, daughter of Whitney Houston, passes away
News.text: The brief, chaotic life of Bobbi Kristina Brown was never really her own. Born and raised in the shadow of fame and litigation, shattered by the loss of her mother, Whitney Houston, Bobbi Kristina was overwhelmed by the achievements and demons of others before she could begin to figure out who she was. Her demise was the most awful inheritance of all. Bobbi Kristina passed away on Sunday at Peachtree Christian Hospice in Duluth, Georgia, about six months after she was found face-down and unresponsive in a bathtub in the suburban Atlanta townhome she shared with Nick Gordon, the man she called her husband. She was 22-years-old. Bobbi Kristina Brown passed away July, 26 2015, surrounded by her family. She is finally at peace in the arms of God. We want to again thank everyone for their tremendous amount of love and support during these last few months,'' Kristen Foster, a representative for the Houston family said Sunday. For latest Music updates, follow us on Twitter >>>@TOIEntertain For the latest in Music news, like us on Facebook >>>TOIEntertain Police said she was found Jan. 31 in the suburban Atlanta townhome she shared with Gordon. A police report described it as a "drowning.'' READ: No progress in comatose Bobbi Kristina Brown's condition Bobbi Kristina was the only child between Houston and Brown. She was hospitalized for months in Atlanta eventually being placed in hospice care after being found in a manner grimly similar to the way her megastar mother died three years earlier. The police report called it a "drowning,'' and Gordon said at the time it seemed she wasn't breathing and lacked a pulse before help arrived. Brown _ the sole heir of her mother's estate _ did have dreams. She identified herself on Twitter as "Daughter of Queen WH,'' "Entertainer/Actress'' with William Morris & Co., and "LAST of a dying breed.'' She told Oprah shortly after her mother's death in 2012 that she wanted to carry on her mother's legacy by singing, acting and dancing. But her career never took off. Actor and producer Tyler Perry said she had a future as an actress after her debut on his TV show "For Better or Worse'' in 2012, but she only appeared in one episode. Aside from two ill-fated reality TV shows and the occasional paparazzi video, her image mostly showed up in the "selfies'' she posted online. She attended award shows and appeared on red carpets with her mother and father. She performed a duet on TV with her mother in 2009, singing "My Love Is Your Love'' in New York's Central Park. She became social media sensation, sending more than 11,000 tweets and attracting 164,000 followers. But Whitney Houston, known as "America's Sweetheart,'' was an impossible act to follow. The late singer sold more than 50 million records in the United States alone during her career. Her voice, an ideal blend of power, grace and beauty, made classics out of songs like "Saving All My Love For You,'' "I Will Always Love You'' and "The Greatest Love of All.'' She earned six Grammys and starred in the films "The Bodyguard'' and "The Preacher's Wife.'' Bobby Brown had a bad-boy image but also became a huge star, selling platinum records with New Edition and going solo before drugs and legal woes derailed his career. Bobbi Kristina appeared alongside both parents in 2005 on the Bravo reality show "Being Bobby Brown,'' which captured her parents fighting, swearing and appearing in court. The Hollywood Reporter said it revealed that Brown was "even more vulgar than the tabloids suggest,'' and managed "to rob Houston of any last shreds of dignity.'' Years earlier, as Houston was preparing to give birth to Bobbi Kristina, she expressly left Bobby Brown out of her will, putting everything in a trust "for the benefit of her children and more remote descendants,'' according to the Houstons' 2012 petition. For more interesting Music news and pictures, follow us on Pinterest>>> timesofindia For latest Music updates, follow us on G+ >>> The Times of India Entertainment After their divorce in 2007, Houston kept custody of Bobbi Kristina and raised her alongside Gordon, an orphan three years older than her daughter. Houston brought Gordon into her family, and while she never formally adopted him or included him in the will, both teenagers called her "mom.'' The threesome's tight bond was shattered when Houston's assistant found the singer's lifeless body face-down in a foot of water in her bathtub at the Beverly Hills Hotel just before the Grammy Awards in 2012. Authorities found prescription drugs in the suite, and evidence of heart disease and cocaine in her body, but determined that it was an accidental drowning. Bobbi Kristina, then 18, was at the hotel and became so hysterical she had to be hospitalized. "She wasn't only a mother, she was a best friend,'' she told Oprah Winfrey. She and Gordon then went public with their romance, posting defiant messages online after the tabloids accused them of incest. The Houstons tolerated their relationship, appearing with them on television that year in Lifetime's reality show "The Houstons: On Our Own.'' But in one telling episode, the late singer's relatives lectured the pair about drinking after they show up in an obviously altered state, and accuse Gordon of failing to take care of the grieving girl. Relations between Gordon and some other relatives continued to sour over the past year after Bobbi Kristina was hospitalized. A protective order barred him from being within 200 feet of Pat Houston, Bobbi Kristina's aunt. A feud erupted over whether Gordon could visit Bobbi Kristina while she stayed in the hospital. On June 24, Bobbi Kristina's court-appointed representative sued Gordon, accusing him of misrepresenting his relationship with Bobbi Kristina. The complaint accused him of being violent toward her and taking more than $11,000 from her account while she was in a medically induced coma after the Jan. 31 tragedy. The lawsuit accused Gordon of assault, battery, intentional infliction of emotional distress, unjust enrichment and conversion. Fulton County District Attorney Paul Howard said he and his office are interested in reviewing the investigative file to determine whether any charges will be filed. Also on June 24, Pat Houston said Bobbi Kristina had been placed in hospice care. Bobbi Kristina was fabulously wealthy for a teenager, but her money was in a spendthrift trust, designed to keep creditors and predators from taking advantage of people who can't manage their money. Bobbi Kristina's grandmother, Cissy Houston, and aunt, Pat Houston, eventually took over control of the trust and then took Bobbi Kristina to court to protect the estate. The Houstons called Bobbi Kristina "a highly visible target for those who would exercise undue influence over her inheritance and/or seek to benefit from (her) resources and celebrity,'' and urged a judge to delay how quickly she could control the money. Bobbi Kristina agreed to the delay, and the judge granted their request to seal the case. The size of Houston's estate is a privately held secret. In May, a judge appointed Bobby Brown and Pat Houston as co-guardians of Bobbi Kristina, giving them joint responsibility in decisions related to her care and medical needs. Lawyer Bedelia Hargrove was appointed conservator to oversee Bobbi Kristina's assets, including her rights and legal claims. Houston signed a $100 million record deal in 2001, but failed to deliver, and lost two homes to foreclosure toward the end of her life. But her early death revived a hunger for her music, and her name and likeness generated revenue that became part of Bobbi Kristina's inheritance. By January 2014, the young couple who grew up as brother and sister were sharing a townhome in Roswell, Georgia, and calling themselves husband and wife. They posted images of their hands wearing wedding rings, with the caption "(hash)HappilyMarried. So (hash)InLove. If you didn't get it the first time that is.'' They got identical "WH'' tattoos with flying doves on their wrists, and Gordon added a large portrait of Houston's face on his arm. Their marriage announcement troubled Pat Houston, who obtained a restraining order against Gordon two months later. "Damn, lol, it's incredible how the world will judge you 4ANY&EVERYthing,'' Bobbi Kristina tweeted at the time. By last September, Pat Houston said she was "very proud of Krissy.'' "Young people today are up against so much with social media and everything else that presents itself to them,'' Pat Houston told The Associated Press. "We try to be there for her, just to try to guide and direct her.'' Judging from her postings online, Bobbi Kristina was focused on the approaching anniversary of her mother's death. In one of her last tweets, she said, "Littlelady&yourgrowing young man (at)nickdgordon miss you mommy ..:') SOmuch.. loving you more every sec. (hash)Anniversary!'' Listen to Whitney Houston's songs on Gaana.com WATCH: Whitney Houston with Enrique Iglesias - Could I Have This Kiss Forever
News.Heading: I love the film James and Alice: Prithviraj
News.text: Prithviraj has always said that he does every movie with total conviction. His latest film, James and Alice, got a luke warm response at the box office, but the outcome is not a criterion, he tells us. "Regardless of the outcome, it will be one of my favourite films." The reason? "Because there are a lot of thoughts discussed in the film which are very personal for me and I agree to." The actor adds that initially he was surprised that the director, Sujith Vasudev, who is a cinematographer, chose such a film for his debut. "Sujith is a good friend and we have worked together earlier. But James and Alice occurs mostly within rooms, with conversations between people forming the major portion of the film. It is not a cinematographer's delight, in that there are no spectacular locations. It is not the easiest film for a debutant either, but Sujith has done an extraordinary job." Prithvriaj and Vedhika play a couple in the film, who go through a rocky patch in their marriage.
News.Heading: Actor Mahesh Babu adopts Siddapuram village of backward Mahbubnagar
News.text: Tollywood's big hero Mahesh Babu has adopted a Telangana village to participate in its development. He has decided to adopt Siddhapuram village of Kottur mandal in backward Mahbubnagar district. READ: Mahesh Babu gifts Audi A6 to Srimanthudu director Mahesh Babu said he decided on the village 'after much thought' discussing it with IT minister K T Rama Rao. "After much thought, KTR garu and myself have chosen to adopt Siddhapuram village of Kottur mandal in Mahbubnagar district. Looking forward to a constructive and meaningful journey ahead," he said on his Twitter. The star adopting a village for its development has been on the cards for now. Actor Prakash Raj also recently adopted a village in Mahbubnagar district. However, Mahesh Babu earlier had also adopted a village in Andhra Pradesh. He adopted Burripalem village in Guntur districts. While the local authorities will help in drawing up plans for the overall development of the village, the funding will have to be provided by the star. This is an initiative of both the Telangana and AP governments which want prominent people to adopt villages and change their complete face in order to provide them better facilities.
News.Heading: Income tax department raids Tamil film actor Vijay and Nayantara's house
News.text: CHENNAI: Income Tax officials raided the premises of actors Vijay, Nayantara and Samantha, and producers and financiers of the Tamil movie "Puli" on Wednesday morning in connection with alleged tax evasion. Sources said IT sleuths were conducting raids on 35 premises in Chennai, Madurai, Kochi, Thiruvananthapuram and Hyderabad from 7am onwards. Raids were going on at Vijay's resort and residence, Nayantara's residence and Samantha's residence and Puli producers' Shibu Thameens and PT Selvakumar premises. Raids were also being held on the premises of film financiers Madurai Anbu and Ramesh. They also raided the residence and office of film producer and distributor Kalaipuli Thanu. Nayantara is not part of the cast of the Vijay-starrer "Puli." The movie, directed by Chimbu Devan, is slated for release on Thursday. It was not confirmed if raids were being held on the premises of the film director.

News.text: Bengaluru's swish set got to check out interesting fashion over canapes and special concoctions at a cocktail party organized by Jyotiee Balani, beverage enthusiast and food writer co-hosted by Sheraton Grand Bangalore Hotel at Brigade Gateway at their lounge Durbar. Spotted at the event were actresses Shubra Aiyappa and Tina Ponnappa, along with some of the party regulars.
News.Heading: Good content is important for audience now: Naishadh Purani
News.text: Naishadh Purani, the director of much talked about play Taap is taking life easy and enjoying himself after the successful staging of this play. The play that was staged at Natrani was quite a talked about. When we asked Naishadh about his experience with the play, he shares, "When I was in the process of thinking about the subject of the play, I was in two minds whether to make one on serious-intense topic or to come up with a comedy one. Ultimately, I chose this topic of exploitation of women in different social circles as well as age groups. It is a burning issue and to deal with this play carefully was much needed." He goes on to add, "I'm happy with the feedback I have received. People were convinced with the idea." Naishadh is also brainstorming currently for his next theatre work. But usually most Gujarati audience prefer comedy as a genre when it comes to theatre. What does Naishadh think about it? "Commercially, people still opt for a comedy play in Gujarati. But, now I strongly feel any theatre work which has a good content and execution is accepted by audience. Also, social networking has been a boon for all the artists like us as we can get better understanding and involvement from audience." In the meanwhile, team Taap is all set to travel across country for more shows.

News.text: Actress Manju Warrier and Ranjith were spotted at a book launch event in Kochi recently.
News.Heading: Bhale Bhale Magadivoi brought Lavanya tears of joy
News.text: Lavanya Tripathi just can't seem to stop herself from breaking into a guffaw when talking about her upcoming rom-com Bhale Bhale Magadivoi. "This is my first romantic comedy and I've never had as much fun as I did on the sets of this film. In fact, I had tears of joy just listening to director Maruthi narrate the script. I was literally rolling on the floor laughing," says a visibly excited Lavanya. Admittedly, her co-star Nani and director Maruthi would constantly tell Lavanya to stop laughing. "Whenever a scene was discussed or being shot, I used to imagine how it would translate on to the screen and a movie would run in front of my eyes and I would immediately burst out laughing. Nani and Maruthi would say, 'You are giving us over confidence. You laugh on everything and we think we are doing it so well. Hopefully it's not just you who finds it funny.' But my laughter was genuine and I think it will be like that for everyone who watches it," shared Lavanya, adding "I am very happy with the way it has shaped up. So my excitement is pretty obvious." The actress fondly recalls her experience of working with Nani, with whom she is teaming up with for the first time, saying, "I always wanted to work with Nani. So this opportunity was a great one. Despite being around for over six years now, it's incredible how he still is like a newcomer on the sets. Nani is a consummate actor and is very keen about his work and puts in extra effort into every single shot. He is very spontaneous too," says the actress who learnt Kuchipudi for this film. Lavanya plays a classical dancer in the movie, but her favourite song though is a beach song, Hello Hello. "We were shooting for it and the same day it started raining. It was apparently the first rain of Goa. I just love rain and the choreographer asked me to just go and enjoy myself and do what I like. I had a really fun time. Nani was forced to join me because I couldn't be in the shot all alone!" recalls Lavanya who happened to run into a childhood friend when shooting in Goa. "She was my friend in college and it was such a proud moment for her to see me working. She had seen me as a kid and now like this shooting and all. It was overwhelming," recalls Lavanya, who confesses to missing shooting for the film. "Every moment on the sets was so much fun. Frankly, I miss the whole crew because we had become friends. It is a thing which happens after every film but this time the film being a funny one, we laughed so often that the memories will remain sweet ones," she says signing off. Bhale Bhale Magadivoi, produced by Bunny Vas and presented by Allu Aravind under Geetha Arts, UV Creations banner, is releasing on Sep 4.

News.Heading: Fake Friday the 13th terror attack on Cannes film stars' hotel
News.text: CANNES: A fake terror attack panicked guests at the French Riviera hideaway of several Hollywood stars at the Cannes film festival, police said. The publicity stunt, by a French internet company aimed at the super rich, saw a speedboat full of men in helmets and military style uniforms attempt to storm the dock of the five- star Hotel du Cap just around the bay from Cannes. Guests said the men were dressed as an "ISIS-like" militia group, referring to the Islamic State group which killed 130 people in a night of attacks on Paris six months ago. Their inflatable speedboat also flew a black flag similar to the one used by IS. Chillingly, the stunt happened on Friday, the first Friday the 13th since the bloodshed in Paris last November. American publicist J.R. Savet, who was dining on the terrace with Vanity Fair editor Graydon Carter when the boat approached, said guests were shocked. "Someone screamed and people jumped out of their chairs and started moving quickly to the swimming pool area. It was pretty scary," he told the Hollywood Reporter. Cannes has been on high terror alert for the 12-day film festival, with a warship moored in the bay and snipers posted on hotel roofs. Oraxy, the Paris-based internet company that organised the stunt, has not yet replied to AFP requests for comment. It describes itself on its website as "the world's first private global marketplace reserved... for Ultra High Net Worth Individuals." A police spokesman told that the men involved in the stunt had earlier tried to breach a sea exclusion zone around Cannes but had been repulsed by the authorities. He said that the men then tried to land at the hotel. Paramilitary gendarmes seized the boat, but the men were not formally arrested. "These men know that they have really overstepped the mark and today they feel ashamed," he added. A justice official told that those behind the stunt were "likely to pay very dearly," and would be prosecuted for breaking maritime rules and for inflicting "psychological trauma". The authorities were also investigating who owns the boat and rented it out, he said. The speedboat had earlier buzzed the yacht of Hollywood legend Steven Spielberg, the "Seven Seas", and another owned by Russian billionaire and Chelsea football club owner Roman Abramovich. The Hotel du Cap - also known as Eden Roch - on the ritzy Cap d'Antibes, refused to comment on the incident or say which stars were in the hotel at the time.

News.Heading: Only after my grandfather passed away did I realise how much my life revolved around him: Rana
News.text: "My thatha's death was the biggest blow I've dealt with in all my life," says Rana Daggubati, recalling how he broke down inconsolably when 'Movie Mogul' Dr D Ramanaidu passed away earlier this year. "I have never seen death in my family, especially not of someone who's so close to me...I might be this big guy from the outside, but I'm very sensitive when it comes to my family," says Rana, who admits that he misses his grandfather more than ever as time goes by. "He would have turned 79 today had he been around," says Rana, his voice choking with emotion. "It was only after he passed on that I realised how much my life revolved around him. Whenever I pass by his car, room or office, which all lie empty now, I feel his absence. It's difficult to put it in words, you know... It's almost like there is so much left to say, but you just don't get a second chance..." And yet, Ramanaidu lives on in the collective memories of the Daggubati family, avers Rana. "We tend to talk about him a lot more these days... He is part of almost every conversation we have at home. After all, he was the pillar of the entire family; his demise has left a huge void which cannot be filled." Life was in the little details for Ramanaidu, and the family still strives to keep intact the little traditions he started. "For instance, he always insisted that the entire family eats together, as long as we were in town. So, two of the three meals were a family affair. We still keep that practice intact," Rana says. Life lessons Ramanaidu gave him is the other thing that Rana holds close to his heart. "He taught me the value of discipline and punctuality... he was a living example of that. He was a methodical man and he stuck to the same schedule with clockwork precision all his life. He'd leave home at 9 am, return for lunch at 1 pm, rest for a couple of hours, and step out again at 4 pm. His day would end a little after 8 pm, post dinner. we were all in perfect sync with his timing. And we all imbibed this discipline into our own lives." As it goes often with life and death, what's left behind are a handful of memories, and Rana says it's the fond memories of time spent with his grandfather as a child that he treasures the most. "I remember spending a lot of time with thatha in my native village, Karamchedu. when we first moved to Hyderabad, I remember him taking me on long drives in his new car every time there was a power cut at home. This was in the early 90s, when the Jubilee Hills area was still a sparsely populated, hilly terrain... I'll cherish those memories forever." So, like most grandparents do, did Ramanaidu also wish to see his grandson married? "Oh... not really," Rana says, adding, "He never liked to impose his thoughts on others. Thatha lived his life to the fullest and he wanted us to do the same. Now you know where that side of mine comes from," he quips, with a smile.
News.Heading: Yoga and walking helped me to shed my weight: Raashi Khanna
News.text: After working out for almost one year, actress Raashi Khanna has finally shed the chubby look and is "six kilos lighter"! What the actress is most surprised to discover was that, yoga and meditation turned out to be more effective in her case, than hitting the gym. "I used to work out twice a day; but to no avail. I kept adding muscle, without losing fat despite following a diet of fish and eggs. It all changed when I went to a spa resort near Haridwar earlier this year. I began to meditate, practice yoga and walk a lot every day. And all that helped me detox." Her exercise regimen is a combination of yoga, dance, walking and two days of functional training at the gym, every week. The trick she lies in figuring out your body type, she says. "I lost six kilos in the past few months, but more than that, I finally figured out what form of exercise works best for my body. It feels great, you know. I've been training in contemporary bollywood dance and working on all the thumkas. I keep pushing the bar and I'm surprised I can pull off some good moves. It's also a good cardio exercise," she says, laughing. Of late, Raashi has been juggling between the sets of Ravi Teja's Bengal Tiger and Ram-starrer Shivam. "Ram is extremely talented and he's full of surprises. Moreover, he has helped me a lot to get my expressions right while acting in a scene. On the other hand, Ravi Teja is a bundle of energy and he's extremely fit. There's always a positive vibe on the sets when he's around," she says signing off.
News.Heading: Whatever I am today is because of tV: Siddharth Shukla
News.text: Actor Siddharth Shukla, who will be making his filmy debut soon, credits his success to TV shows. I WILL NEVER LEAVE TV Actor Siddharth Shukla is absolutely certain that he will not leave television. After signing a three film deal with producer director Karan Johar, Siddharth is making his Bollywood debut with Humpty Sharma Ki Dulhania. While in Lucknow to promote the show Balika Vadhu, in which he plays Shivraj Anoop Shekhar, Anandi's husband, Siddharth says that he will try and work out a balance between TV and films. "Whatever I am today is because of television, so I will never leave TV completely. As it is, films are a new experience for me where as TV is a known medium. A lot of credit for my success today goes to the serial Balika Vadhu," says the tall good looking actor. ALSO READ: Siddharth Shukla gets nostalgic 'Jhalak...' set BALIKA IS NOT AT THE END OF ITS ROAD Defending his show Siddhartha says that viewers are still loving his show. "See, everyone at some point of time feels a little lazy and drained out. Similarly for a TV show too. Kabhi achha lagta hai, kabhi nahi. This see-saw thing goes on everywhere but that doesn't mean you put an end to it. In fact later, you will work doubly hard to make up for that complacency. Same is the case with our show. We are constantly coming up with new tracks to keep the viewers attracted to the show. And it's simple, had the show not been doing well, the channel wouldn't have kept giving us extensions. It's been running strong for the past six years. There's a lot more left to do in Balika...," says he. TV IS NOT A FEMALE DOMINATED MEDIUM Siddharth doesn't feel that content on TV is women oriented. "Nothing can work without a balance. I agree Balika... initially focused mainly on Anandi, but over the years, even the men are getting their due. In fact I feel that goes for all shows on TV. There are no leads in a serial. Mainly because a story can't function with just one person. At some point or the other, every character gets prominence over the others and they become the lead in the show at that time. For instance in Balika..., the focus is on my character Shiv these days, so in that sense I am the lead," says Siddharth with a smile. READ: No girl would want to be in relationship with me says Siddharth Shukla NO TIME FOR LOVE Touted as one of the most eligible bachelors of the small screen, Siddharth takes the compliment with a question , "Really? Where are the girls?, adding, "I like the company of women but given my present situation I am sure no girl would like to date me. I have such a busy schedule from 5 am to 11 pm, that I can't devote time to anyone however much I may like to. For the time being I have to remain single," says he with a shrug. News.Heading: It's Dr Sai Pallavi now!
News.text: Sai Pallavi is not just an actress any more. The 'Malar miss' of Premam, who stole the hearts of Malayalis through her debut film, has just graduated from her university in Georgia and is a doctor now. In an exclusive chat, 'Dr Sai Pallavi' speaks on the joy of graduating, her future plans, movies and more: So, you are now officially a doctor... As I speak to you, I am at the convocation ceremony and I am overjoyed! The mood here is quite vibrant and I'm enjoying every minute of it. Since my childhood, I used to tell my parents to keep a tab on their health as if I was a doctor. Now I am officially one and I hope my parents will finally take me seriously (laughs)! Now that you have graduated, will medicine take precedence over acting? I don't plan anything in my life. I have a few more exams to give, but if I get good opportunities and challenging roles to play, I would love to continue acting. I will definitely stick to medical profession, no doubts about that! Was wearing a stethoscope and treating people, always your dream? Becoming a doctor has not been my ambition, as such. The aim was to help people, to feel better, to know what is good and what is not. We all know that smoking is harmful and we all are exposed to secondary smoke, but not many know the harmful effects of it. I always wanted to create awareness and spread the word that it is important to respect one's own body and work towards its well-being. If not anything, I felt that I can at least take care of the people around. I wanted to learn more about body and health, as it is a wonderful gift of God. The last year of your college might have been the most hectic one for you, as you had to juggle films and studies. How difficult was it? It was a bit hectic, but for the past three months, I have been detached from the film world to focus on my studies. It was still tough to not think of movies as people kept tagging me with film-related posts. But somehow, I managed to concentrate and I'm happy about that. When I am in India, I feel pampered. However when I am in Georgia, I am on my own, as I have to cook and do things all by myself. However, that gives me an independent feeling. Your upcoming projects I have been reading several scripts, but nothing has been finalised yet. I believe if you are destined to do something, things will definitely happen. The character Malar is something that I never expected to happen, but people lapped it up and the role is quite close to my heart. Now, I believe God selects the best for me. In a recent photo shoot for a magazine, you were presented without pimples and a lot of fans commented online that Sai Pallavi did not look herself in those snaps. Did it bother you? Who wouldn't be happy to hear that? Every girl would want to hear that she looks good without makeup. I was overjoyed because of the fact that people love me for who I am. When it comes to conventional beauty standards, things such as pimples can affect one's self esteem. My sister is going through a similar phase due to peer pressure. To empower her, my well-wishers take my name saying that I am an example for her. It feels good. How did you handle the rumour 'Mani Ratnam rejects Sai Pallavi'? Just like anybody else, I have been following Mani Ratnam sir and I love his works. He knows who is the best for the character and what is good for me. I don't consider it a controversy, as he was sweet enough to tell me that there have been a few changes in the script. He was very kind to explain me why it needed a change in the cast. So, I don't think I had to get affected by it and I'm not, either.
News.Heading: Bollywood actress Aparnaa Bajpai debuts in Malayalam

He woos her until she says 'yes' to him," explains Aparnaa. "The film is about relationships and our love story is pivotal to it." Also, my friends kept telling me that I will have a lot to take back home after working in a Malayalam movie," she gushes, adding, "And it was really easy for me to mingle with my co-stars and face the camera here as I have already worked in two Tamil films." The actress is also currently busy with a Bollywood film titled XXX, an erotic drama directed by Ken Ghosh. "It's a portmanteau movie with four short stories of different genres. Mine is a female-oriented vignette and I play its protagonist, a village belle. I am not at liberty to reveal more details," she signs off.
News.Heading: Kunchackos Kochuouvva is based on a real person
News.text: Real-life characters are increasingly serving as fodder for Malayalam movies of late. After Nivin Pauly's 'Jacobinte Swargarajyam', Kunchacko Boban's upcoming movie Kochuouvva Paulo Ayyappa Coelho has also borrowed elements from the life of a real person. In tune with its title, the film revolves around two characters Kochuouvva played by Kunchacko Boban and Ayyappa Das portrayed by actor Sudheesh's son Master Rudraksh. The former plays a character who tries to fix others' problems. "My character Kochuouvva is based on a real person," says Kunchacko Boban. "If we actually mirror his real-life actions and generosity on screen, the audience would find it too cinematic. The irony is that we actually had to tone down his actions a bit for the film." While the actor doesn't reveal who the character is based on, he says that the movie has a fresh theme that would appeal to everyone. "The central characters in the movie have different aims in life but a particular incident unites their path towards these goals. Paulo Coelho's writings are what bring them together," explains the 'School Bus' actor. Incidentally, the film will once again have Kunchacko playing a rustic youth similar to the character in his latest release directed by Rishi Sivakumar. "While it has a serious theme at the core, director Sidhartha Siva has ensured that the film is made in a very entertaining way. It will be a refreshing movie, replete with songs and a lot of humour." 'Kochuouvva Paulo Ayyappa Coelho', which also has Aju Varghese and Suraj Venjaramoodu, has already finished two schedules and is currently waiting for the monsoons to hit to resume the shooting. However, the team is yet to zero in on the lead actress for the movie.
News.Heading: Pearle to play a biker in Sreesanth-starrer
News.text: It's well-known that anchor-actress Pearle Maaney is also an ace biker, who has displayed her skills both on small screen and in films like Neelakasham Pachakadal Chuvanna Bhoomi. Soon, she will be getting a chance to perform stunts on her mean machine, in her upcoming movie Team Five, which has cricketer Sreesanth playing the lead. The film is directed and scripted by debutant Suresh Govind. "Pearle plays Aleena, who is a bubbly, sporty girl and is into biking," says the director. "She is a college student and her character brings in the twist and change of tone in the film. At the same time, she can't be termed a freak. Even in looks, she comes across as a normal girl. Also, the film showcases two phases in the life of her character. " The team would be shooting the biking sequences mostly in Bangalore, Goa and Fort Kochi. The film has two strong female protagonists, the other role being played by Nikki Galrani. Pearle, who is currently co-hosting a dance reality show says that she is all set to hone her biking skills. "I will have to train a bit for the role and learn stunts like wheelies, which professional stunt bikers often perform at shows. I am quite excited, but also tensed thinking whether I would end up hurting myself as the stunts aren't easy to pick up and would need some careful, focused training. 'Make sure there is enough of cotton stuffed around me,' I have told the team," she says. The actress is also excited to meet Sreesanth. "I have never met him before, but have heard that he is a wonderful artiste and an affable personality," she says.

News.Heading: My mom taught me to be independent: Aparna Gopinath
News.text: Aparna Gopinath is a self-confessed mommy's girl. The actress, who has always stood apart from the rest , off and on screen, says that it is her mother who has influenced her the most in life, be it in her life or career. "My mother has influenced me the most in my life. She was the one who taught me to have courage and strength, to be a confident individual and not get carried away by all that glitters," she says. ""She taught me to always stand on my own two feet and to be independent." Her mother is also the reason she is an actress today, Aparna adds. "She gifted me with the greatest present in my life by introducing me to the stage. I am who I am today, as a person and as a professional, because of my mom." However, despite all this, her mother still treats her like a baby, she admits. "She spoils me silly and gives in to all of my whims and fancies. She treats me like I am five years old even today and I wouldn't have it any other way."
