But on the minds of law enforcement are cases like that of a young Frenchman known as Abu Oussama, seen in extraordinary hidden camera footage captured by an undercover documentary filmmaker. Flagged to police by his father, detained in Turkey trying to reach Syria, he was imprisoned in France for five months until authorities determined he was no longer a danger, he says. Yet the young man says he is plotting an attack on his homeland. "They said since I was de-radicalized, since I was quiet..." he says, giggling toward the camera he cannot see. "It's all part of the ruse, brother."
News.Heading: 'China fakes 488m social media posts a yr'
News.text: China's government fabricates about 488 million social media comments a year - nearly the same as one day of Twitter's total global volume - in a massive effort to distract its citizens from bad news and sensitive political debates, according to a study. Three scholars led by Gary King, a political scientist at Harvard University who specialises in using quantitative data to analyse public policy, ran the first systematic study of China's online propaganda workers, known as the Fifty Cent Party because they are popularly believed to be paid by the government 50 Chinese cents for every social media post. Contrary to popular perception inside China, the Fifty Cent Party avoids engaging in debates with critics and doesn't make fun of foreign governments. Instead, it mostly works to distract public attention away from hot topics by highlighting the positive, cheering the state, symbols of the regime, or the Communist Party's revolutionary past. Although those who post comments are often rumored to be ordinary citizens, the researchers were surprised to find that nearly all the posts were written by workers at government agencies including tax and human resource departments, and at courts. The team based their findings on leaked archives of 2013 and 2014 e-mails from the Internet Propaganda Office of Zhanggong, a county-level district of nearly half a million people in Ganzhou City, in Jiangxi, a province in southeast China King and his team pulled out 2,341 e-mails of which more than half contained a Fifty Cent post, totaling 43,797 posts that formed a benchmark for identifying other propaganda posts. They were able to identify Fifty Centers by cross referencing names from leaked e-mails with online social media profiles.
News.Heading: Egypt president says no theory favoured on EgyptAir crash
News.text: CAIRO: Egypt's President Abdel Fattah al-Sisi said on Sunday that no theory was being favoured on why the EgyptAir MS804 plunged into the Mediterranean Sea and that Egypt was using a submarine to locate the black boxes. The Airbus A320 carrying 66 people had crashed into the sea while flying from Paris to Cairo early on Thursday, and some wreckage has been found. However, the black boxes are still missing. Egypt's aviation minister had said that terrorism was a more likely reason than technical failure, but Sisi said in a televised address that "all the theories are possible". He added, "There is no particular theory we can affirm right now." Sisi said a submarine that could operate at a depth of 9,800 feet under sea level had been deployed on Sunday to search for the black boxes. "This (submarine) moved today in the direction of the plane crash because we are working hard to retrieve the two boxes, which are the black boxes," he said. A civil aviation official had on Sunday said that search teams had found none of the passengers' bodies.
News.Heading: Russians warplanes raid key Syrian rebel supply route
News.text: BEIRUT: A key rebel supply route to Aleppo has been the latest target of Russian warplanes in the latest round of ceasefire which has been on going since February, a monitoring group has said. "The Russian and Syrian warplanes together carried out at least 40 air strikes on the Castello road," Syrian Observatory for Human Rights chief Rami Abdel Rahman said. "They are the heaviest air strikes there since February, and they are also the first confirmed Russian strikes since the truce began," Abdel Rahman said. The violence wracking Aleppo city over the past month has killed some 300 civilians and left world powers scrambling to save the fragile truce brokered by the United States and Russia nearly three months ago. The northern city once Syria's commercial powerhouse is divided between rebel groups in the east and regime forces in the west. The Castello road is a key supply route for rebels leading north out of Aleppo. Even while the rest of the city witnessed relative calm in the first few weeks of the truce, fierce fighting has raged for the highway. On Friday, Moscow proposed joint air strikes with Washington against jihadists in Syria from Wednesday, but its offer was spurned. Russia has been carrying out air strikes in Syria since last September in support of its ally President Bashar al-Assad. Washington launched its air war against the Islamic State group and other jihadists in Syria in 2014. Pentagon spokesman Navy Captain Jeff Davis said the US military does "not collaborate or coordinate with the Russians on any operations in Syria." US State Department spokesman John Kirby said nothing had been agreed with Moscow as its ally Damascus was responsible for the "vast majority" of violations of the February ceasefire. Russia's intervention has significantly strengthened the Syrian government in the five-year-old civil war that has killed more than 270,000 people and driven millions from their homes.
News.Heading: Taliban leader Mullah Akhtar Mansour killed in US drone attack in Pakistan
News.text: WASHINGTON/KABUL: Afghan Taliban leader Mullah Akhtar Mansour was killed in a rare US drone strike deep inside Pakistan, the Afghan spy agency announced on Sunday. Mansour's death is a body blow for the insurgents and removes a major obstacle to the fragile peace process in war-torn Afghanistan. Mansour and another militant were targeted by multiple unmanned aircraft operated by US Special Operations forces on Saturday as the duo rode in a vehicle in a remote area near the town of Ahmad Wal in the restive Baluchistan province close to the Afghan border, US officials said. Afghanistan's main spy agency said Mansour was killed in a US drone attack inside Pakistan. "Mansour was being closely monitored for a while ... until he was targeted along with other fighters aboard a vehicle ... in Balochistan," the National Directorate of Security said in a brief statement. Speaking to reporters in the Myanmar capital Naypyidaw, US secretary of state John Kerry said, "Mansour posed ... an imminent threat to US personnel, Afghan civilians and Afghan security forces." Kerry said Mansour was also directly opposed to peace negotiations. The US "has long maintained that an Afghan-led, Afghan-owned reconciliation process is the surest way to ensure peace ... peace is what we want, Mansour was a threat to that," Kerry added. The Pentagon earlier confirmed it targeted Mansour, said to be in his early 50s, in an operation authorized by President Barack Obama. The deaths of Taliban leaders have sometimes been falsely reported. Mansour himself was said to have been killed last December. Mansour assumed the leadership in July 2015, replacing Taliban founder and the one-eyed reclusive long-time spiritual head Mullah Mohammad Omar in Pakistan in 2013. "Mansour has been the leader of the Taliban and actively involved with planning attacks against facilities in Kabul and across Afghanistan, presenting a threat to Afghan civilians and security forces, our personnel, and Coalition partners," said Pentagon Press Secretary Peter Cook. "Mansour has been an obstacle to peace and reconciliation between the government of Afghanistan and the Taliban, prohibiting Taliban leaders from participating in peace talks with the Afghan government that could lead to an end to the conflict," he said. The drone strike inside Pakistan was a rare one since US Navy Seals killed al-Qaida chief Osama bin Laden in a stealth raid in the Pakistani garrison city of Abbottabad in 2011. "Since the death of Mullah Omar and Mansour's assumption of leadership, the Taliban have conducted many attacks that have resulted in the death of tens of thousands of Afghan civilians and Afghan security forces as well as numerous US and Coalition personnel," Cook said. The United States informed both Pakistan and Afghanistan shortly after the strike, a senior White House official said.
News.Heading: Chinese city hit by heaviest rain in two centuries
News.text: BEIJING: An extremely rare round of heavy torrential rainfall stated to be once in more than 200 years has lashed a Chinese city in Guangdong province in which eight people were killed and four others listed missing. Xinyi, a small, county-level city in Maoming received 429.5 millimetres of rainfall in just six hours, according to the provincial flood control and drought relief headquarters. Eight people died and four others were reportedly missing in Xinyi. The provincial civil affairs department has declared the second highest state of emergency and dispatched working teams to Xinyi. Relief supplies including 200 tents and 10 tonnes of rice have been sent to the disaster-hit areas, state run Xinhua news agency reported. The rainstorm abated yesterday afternoon and stopped in the evening. But local authorities still warned of geological disasters in mountainous area.
News.Heading: Sitaram Yechury made a historic mistake: Akbar
News.text: Ranchi: "Sitaram Yechury made a historic mistake in tying up with the Congress in West Bengal ,'' BJP MP MJ Akbar said here on Friday. Describing the debut of the BJP in Assam as a massive endorsement of Prime Minister Narendra Modi's leadership, Akbar said that the CPM under Yechury has repeated the same blunder the Communist Party of India made in 1969. Founder of CPI, Shripad Amrit Dange had to face a lot of flak at that time for supporting the Congress. "At least at that time the Congress had a leader like Indira Gandhi. But Yechury committed a crime by forging a jote (alliance) with the Congress under the leadership of Rahul Gandhi which is why the CPM was routed in West Bengal,'' said Akbar. Akbar who was here in connection with the Modi government completing two years at the Centre said that the Prime Minister has brought about an economic revolution in the country, breaking away from the tradition of conventional economy. "Though poverty alleviation is a constitutional requirement, Modi in his first speech in Parliament had said that the age of poverty alleviation was over and it was now an era of poverty elimination,'' he said. Modi's agenda is to raise the economy of the poor, said Akbar claiming that the Jan dhan Yojna has come as a major setback to the chit funds across the nation. He was also all praise for chief minister Raghubar Das for the victory of BJP in Godda by-election in Jharkhand , the result of which were declared on Thursday. "The result was proof of the good work that the chief minister has started in the state." It is certainly due to the dynamic leadership of the Prime Minister who has shown us the way to development, but it is the chief minister who is getting them executed, he said.
News.Heading: Hours after dad gives up, son in bizarre US entrapment case caught
News.text: PINEDALE (Wyoming): A woman and her four teenage daughters who were lured to a Utah house and tied up in the basement were thrilled and relieved to learn the father and son charged in the bizarre attack were in custody in Wyoming, authorities said. But despite their arrests, neither man was cooperating with investigators trying to learn more about what led up to the violence. Officers culminated a manhunt late Saturday night with the arrest of Dereck James "DJ" Harrison, 22, several hours after the surrender of his father, Flint Wayne Harrison, 51, the Sublette county sheriff's office said. The men face various charges stemming from the Tuesday attack in Centerville, Utah, including aggravated kidnapping and possession of a controlled substance. The younger Harrison was arrested without incident shortly after 10pm MDT, in the forested Half Moon Lake area of western Wyoming. He was booked into the county jail. He told the US Forest Service officer who arrested him that he had been hiding in the trees and brush most of the day until he saw a helicopter involved in the search and knew police were closing in, Centerville Lt Von Steenblik said. He walked toward officers who were manning a roadblock and surrendered, officials said. Police had said the younger Harrison was heavily armed with rifles and knives, but he was unarmed when authorities arrested him, the lieutenant said. His father turned himself in earlier in the day and had been helping authorities find his son. "This is an incredible end to a very stressful day," sheriff Stephen Haskell said. Meanwhile, authorities said the woman and her daughters are recovering after the attack Tuesday in Centerville, Utah. "They're very happy, very relieved, and just trying to move on," Steenblik said. The men are accused of tying the mother and daughters up with zip ties. When the elder Harrison hit the woman with a baseball bat, the teens began to break their ties and try to escape, according to charging documents. In the struggle that followed, one girl slapped away a shotgun pointed at her throat and another grabbed the bat and hit the son, police said. The victims managed to escape. The father and son had been using methamphetamine heavily over several days and falsely believed the woman had reported them to authorities, police said. Both have refused to talk to investigators since their arrests, Steenblik said. The younger Harrison was a close friend of the woman's family. He often visited the home for dinner or picked the girls up from school. The teens, aged 13 to 18, had known him for several years. The Harrisons fled and were eventually picked up by someone who took them to Salt Lake City, where they spent Tuesday night in a hotel. The elder Harrison is a registered sex offender. He surrendered in Pinedale for reasons still unknown to police.
News.Heading: Woman cannot name daughter 'Cyanide': UK court
News.text: LONDON: A mother cannot name her daughter 'Cyanide', a British court has ruled in a landmark case, saying her unusual choice might harm her children. The woman, who also chose the name Preacher for the girl's twin brother, insisted that she had a right to name her own children. But the mother, from Powys, Wales, was thwarted by top judges on Thursday. In the first case of its kind, appeal court judges ruled that it was an "extreme" case and that the mother's "unusual" choices might harm her children. The mother has a chaotic history of mental illness, drug and alcohol abuse and relationships with abusive men, said Lady Justice King. The twins, who are infants, and two of their half-siblings are now living with foster parents, Wales Online reported. When Powys county council social workers learnt of the names the mother had chosen for the twins, they took the case to court in an unprecedented step. In June last year, a judge issued an injunction against the mother, forbidding her from formally registering the twins' unorthodox forenames. Her lawyers appealed, insisting that the refusal to let her name her own children violated her right to respect for family life. Lady Justice King, sitting with Lady Justice Gloster and Lord Justice David Richards, said that naming a little girl after a "notorious poison" was simply unacceptable. Although there was nothing seriously objectionable about the name Preacher, she ruled that both twins' names should be chosen by their older half-siblings. While ruling in the landmark case, the judge said that "even allowing for changes in taste, fashion and developing individual perception," Cyanide was a very odd name to give to a baby girl. The mother said Preacher was a "rather cool name" which sent a "strong spiritual" message and which would "stand my son well for the future". Cyanide, she said, was a "lovely, pretty name" and had positive connotations as the poison which ended the lives of both Hitler and his aide Paul Goebbels. Justice King said the courts would intervene to prevent a parent naming a child "in only the most extreme cases". But she ruled, "This is one of those rare cases where the court should intervene to protect the girl twin from emotional harm that I am satisfied she would suffer if called Cyanide."
News.Heading: Portugal culture minister wants to slap critics
News.text: Critics of Portugal's culture minister are calling on him to be fired for doing something, well, uncultured. After being called "incompetent" and promoting a "work style of chronyism, domineering and rudeness", culture minister Joao Soares reckoned it was time to slap two columnists at an influential newspaper. "I see that I do have to find him (columnist Augusto Seabra), and now also Vasco Pulido Valente, to give them some sound slapping. It will be good for them. And for me," Soares wrote in a Facebook post on Thursday. Sergio Azevedo, deputy bench leader for the main opposition Social Democrats, said Soares' remarks were incompatible with the government job. "There's only one way for him. Out," he wrote on the same social network. The original post garnered over 800 mostly critical comments with many calling for his resignation. The ministry would not comment and Soares, son of former prime minister and president Mario Soares, was not reachable.
News.Heading: Escaped US inmate found hiding in dishwasher of his girlfriends apartment
News.text: A Texas county jail inmate who escaped custody while receiving treatment in a hospital was found in the dishwasher of his girlfriend's apartment in boxer shorts and wearing handcuffs with the chain severed, a sheriff's department said on Thursday. "He took out the racks and made himself a nice cubby hole," said chief deputy Glenn Blank of the Jasper county sheriff's office in East Texas. The inmate, Wesley Evans, 20, was captured on Wednesday morning and was taken back into custody after an escape that lasted about 24 hours. He is expected to face charges for the escape attempt. Evans has been in jail since March 8 on charges of aggravated robbery, auto theft and arson. He was taken to the hospital for treatment of a swollen hand.
News.Heading: US man faces jail for refusing to take down Donald Trump flag
News.text: NEW YORK: Republican presidential hopeful Donald Trump appears to have a passionate supporter in Joseph Hornick, a New Jersey man who faces a $2,000 fine or 90 days in jail for flying a flag emblazoned with the billionaire candidate's name over his home. Local officials said the flag violates an ordinance prohibiting the display of political signs more than 30 days ahead of an election and issued him a summons. New Jersey's primary is on June 7. For weeks, Hornick has displayed the blue flag with Trump's "Make America Great Again!" campaign slogan on a pole outside his two-story West Long Branch house, at a busy intersection near Monmouth University, in a show of his support for Trump. Trump has been campaigning this week in neighboring New York in an effort to snag the Republican presidential nomination. Despite being issued a summons on March 25 for the violation, Hornick apparently intends to keep it up. "The fine can be in the Millions of dollars! That flag will never come down!" he wrote in a defiant Facebook post. Hornick did not immediately respond to requests for comment. Lori Cole, West Long Branch's clerk, said on Friday that Hornick, 54, could also face 90 days in jail as a maximum penalty if a judge determines he is in violation of the law. "It just came up recently," she said of the controversy. Brian Hegarty, a former Democratic Party councilman, complained to authorities about Hornick's flag, according to a March 25 police report. Hegarty told police that he had complained several times about the flag to a code enforcement official, but no action was taken. Sergeant James Gomez in the report said Hornick initially agreed to take down the flag before speaking with his attorney. "He advised on the advice of an attorney he would not be removing the flag and would fight any summons issued to him," Gomez wrote. Hornick is scheduled to appear in court on April 20.
News.Heading: Saudi woman burns home as husband goes on second honeymoon
News.text: DUBAI: A mother of six in Saudi Arabia has burnt her house after learning that her husband had gone abroad for a second honeymoon, a media report said today. The woman, who has been married for 10 years, was shocked to receive a text message from her husband, that he married a second wife and was travelling abroad with her for their honeymoon, Gulf News reported. In a fit of rage, she set her home in Jazan port city on fire. However, when she saw the house being engulfed by the blaze, she raised an alarm for assistance from her neighbours, Saudi news website Al Sada reported. The fire was doused by the fire brigade. A fire official said that one child, reportedly aged five, was harmed in the blaze. The case was referred to the police for investigation.
News.Heading: Ohio home of serial killer for rent during Republican convention
News.text: CLEVELAND: The Ohio childhood home of serial killer Jeffrey Dahmer, available for rent in time for the Republican National Convention this summer, could have been had for $8,000 a month until Friday afternoon, when the price went up and references to the infamous criminal came down. The home where Dahmer grew up and in 1978 committed his first murder is in Bath, Ohio, 26 miles south of Cleveland, where the convention is scheduled to be held in July. The listing on a real-estate company website initially included a reference to Dahmer but on Friday that was removed and the price had been increased to $10,000 a month. Dahmer was convicted in 1992 in the murder and dismemberment of 17 boys and men, some of whom he ate, over a period of 14 years. He was beaten to death in 1994 by another prison inmate while serving 15 life terms in Wisconsin, where most of the murders took place after he moved there. The listing by Howard Hanna, the official real estate broker for the convention, had been up since February and initially included the fact that the three-bedroom, two-bathroom, 2,170-square-foot home was once occupied by Dahmer. It had described the house as a "mid-century modern home with a true park-like setting. Smoking and animals okay. This is Jeffrey Dahmer's childhood home. Close to Cuyahoga Valley National Park, Montrose shopping. Easy access to I-77 highway." By Friday afternoon, the Dahmer sentence had been removed. Julia Domenick, the listing agent at Hanna, could not be reached for comment. In 1978, at age 18, Dahmer killed a teenaged hitchhiker, then dismembered and buried the body in a shallow grave behind the Bath house. Homeowner Chris Butler, a member of the Akron-based punk band The Waitresses, bought the house in 2005 for $295,000 after its history was disclosed. He could not be reached for comment.
News.Heading: Drone hunt for Loch Ness Monster finds its film double
News.text: A high-tech marine drone scouring the depths of Scotland's Loch Ness for one of nature's most elusive beasts has found a "monster" but not the one it was looking for. Rather than the fabled Loch Ness Monster itself, the probe has discovered a 30-foot (9 metre) replica used in the 1970 film "The Private Life of Sherlock Holmes", which sank nearly 50 years ago after its buoyant humps were removed. Undeterred, the enthusiastic monster-hunters steering the drone are continuing their two-week search for any evidence that might prove the existence of "Nessie". The survey by Norwegian company Kongsberg Maritime has been the most detailed to date of the Loch's icy depths. The Munin drone is capable of mapping vast areas down to 1,500 feet and is often used to locate downed aircraft. "The vehicle allows sonars to scan just a few metres from the loch floor, giving resolution several orders of magnitude greater than anything before," said Kongsberg Maritime engineer Craig Wallace. Along with the movie replica, it has also found a 27-foot shipwreck as it maps the Loch floor. Far from being disappointed by the findings, Steve Feltham who has been hunting Nessie for 25 years, says the maps will help him in his quest. "I think the findings are fantastic," he said. "We now have a more detailed map of the rock bottom than ever before, which will show us the location of every lump and bump. "We can send back cameras to look at anything of interest which could turn out to be the carcass of the animal," he added. "It's shown there's a hell of a lot more to investigate." The first written record of a monster relates to the Irish monk St Columba, who is said to have banished a "water beast" to the depths of the River Ness in the 6th century. The most famous picture of Nessie, known as the "surgeon's photo", was taken in 1934 and showed a head on a long neck emerging from the water. It was revealed 60 years later to have been a hoax that used a sea monster model attached to a toy submarine. Countless unsuccessful attempts to track down the monster have been made in the years since, notably in 2003 when the BBC funded an extensive scientific search that used 600 sonar beams and satellite tracking to sweep the full length of the loch. It concluded there was probably nothing there.
News.Heading: Flight attendant leaves packed plane using emergency slide
News.text: AUSTIN (Texas): A flight attendant deployed an emergency evacuation slide on an airplane after it arrived in Houston and used it to exit a plane packed with passengers, an airline official said. "It is our understanding that she deployed it intentionally," said United Airlines spokesman Charlie Hobart, adding airline officials have been speaking with the flight attendant to see why she deployed the slide in the incident that took place on Monday. In a video shown on Houston TV station KPRC, the flight attendant tosses her bag out of a door behind the cockpit and slides down the slide. She grabs the bag and walks away from the plane, which was at full stop. A photo of the airplane on the station's website shows it at the gate, with the slide deployed on the side opposite of the gate. The flight, with 159 passengers and six crew members aboard, was from Sacramento to Houston's George Bush Intercontinental Airport. The airplane, a Boeing 737-900, was briefly taken out of service for maintenance and then was returned to its scheduled use. The flight attendant, who was not identified by the airline, has been removed from flying duties. All the others aboard exited the plane without incident or injury.
News.Heading: Thai woman faces sedition trial for posing with plastic bowl
News.text: BANGKOK: A Thai woman has been charged with sedition, police said on Tuesday, after photos were spread of her holding a red bowl allegedly bearing a message from an ex-premier who lies at the heart of the kingdom's bitter politics. The images showed Theerawan Charoensuk, 54, holding a hand-sized bowl with a goodwill note apparently signed by former Prime Minister Thaksin Shinawatra, whose powerful political dynasty is locked in a decadelong struggle with the kingdom's military-backed royalist elite. She faces up to seven years in jail if convicted. Her arrest comes as the ruling junta, who toppled a government led by Thaksin's sister in 2014, hardens its clampdown on political expression ahead of a referendum on a controversial charter it has penned. The small bowl is used to pour water during Buddhist ceremonies and was distributed at a temple fair in northern Chiang Mai, the Shinawatra's hometown. It was painted red a colour with strong associations to the family's supporters, who are known as the "Red Shirts". Local media reported it was signed by Thaksin along with a slogan that read: "The situation may be hot, but brothers and sisters may gain coolness from the water inside this bucket". Police declined to comment on the details of the bowl, saying only that they believed it was handed out by a "certain political party". "She was charged with section 116 inciting chaos in the country," said Nateephat Akarapongthiti from Chiang Mai's Mae Ping police station. The junta has outlawed all political activities and protests since the coup, in a vow to bridge the kingdom's vast divides. But critics say the generals are more focused on rooting out the influence of the Shinawatras, who have dominated electoral politics for the past 10 years and are seen as a threat to the elite's status quo. Junta chief Prayut Chan-O-Cha told reporters Tuesday he found the charge was "suitable" because "it might be a national security threat". "It was [a show of] support for people who have violated laws and run away from criminal charge," he said, a reference to Thaksin, who lives in self-imposed exile to avoid a corruption conviction. Police said Theerawan, a Chiang Mai resident, was released from custody today and will now face trial in a military court. "She said she held up the bowl, but she didn't think that was wrong," Nateephat told AFP. Rights groups say the junta has increasingly leaned on the country's tough sedition law to silence critics.
News.Heading: Woman faces deportation from UAE for checking husbands phone
News.text: DUBAI: A woman was fined and ordered to be deported from the United Arab Emirates for breaching her husband's privacy by checking his cell phone to see if he was cheating on her, Gulf News reported on Wednesday. The unnamed Arab expatriate was fined 150,000 dirhams ($40,843) by the criminal court in the emirate of Ajman, the English-language newspaper said. Her lawyer told the paper she had accused her husband of having an affair. She admitted she had accessed his phone without his permission and transferred photos to her device, the lawyer added. The husband lodged a complaint with the court which convicted her on Thursday last week under a cybercrime law which penalises "the invasion of privacy of another person" using information technology, the paper said. It said the couple were in their 30s but gave no other information.
News.Heading: Size matters at Japans phallus festival
News.text: KAWASAKI: Japanese revellers carried giant phalluses through the streets of Kawasaki on Sunday to worship the humble penis and fertility in one of the world's most unusual festivals. Size matters at the Shinto Kanamara Matsuri, where groups of locals parade three heavy phalluses around the city the biggest as tall as a full-grown man. Giggling festival-goers, including young children and grandmothers dressed in kimonos, sucked on penis lollipops and posed with phallus-shaped sculptures as political correctness was ignored for the day. An anatomically correct radish-carving contest drew a large crowd of sniggering onlookers, while blushing parents perched babies on a giant see-saw of frighteningly accurate likeness to pray for fertility. Tens of thousands gather every spring for the festival, where they can buy keepsakes such as key chains, trinkets, pens, chocolates and even toy glasses with a plastic penis nose. For the local priest of the Kanayama Shrine, however, it is no laughing matter. "If young children are not used to seeing (male genitalia), they could get into a bit of a panic when the time comes," Hiroyuki Nakamura told AFP, explaining the festival's educational role. "People come to pray for good fortune and to ask the gods to protect them. The festival is steeped in the past but has still has a valuable part to play in modern society." Known as the Festival of the Steel Phallus or colloquially as the "Willy Festival" legend has it that in the Edo Period (1603-1868) a sharp-toothed demon inhabiting a woman's vagina castrated several unfortunate young men on their wedding nights. A local blacksmith came to the rescue by forging an iron dildo to break the demon's teeth and today a three-foot (one-metre) black steel phallus sits in the shrine's courtyard to honour the Shinto deities of fertility, childbirth and protection from sexually transmitted infections. Over the centuries, sex workers also made a pilgrimage to the shrine to seek its powers of protection before the festival became a tourist attraction in the 1970s. "I think it's brilliant," said Sayuri Kubo, a 14-year-old schoolgirl proudly holding an erotic lollipop. "The mikoshi (portable shrine) parade was awesome." Three mikoshi are lugged through the streets of Kawasaki, including a giant pink phallus called Elizabeth, donated by a local drag queen club. There is a serious side to the frivolity, despite the bizarre sight of normally reserved Japanese housewives posing for snapshots with oversized dildos. Proceeds from sales of the saucy memorabilia go to HIV research while the shrine itself is visited year-round by married couples hoping to start a family. "It's about propagating the species," nursery school teacher Natsuki Kanayama told AFP, holding lollipops in both hands with another poking out of her cleavage. "I'm praying that I can have as many children as possible." Not surprisingly, however, the festival drew curious stares from visiting foreigners. "It's insane," said American tourist Jason Bradley. "I've heard about 'Cool Japan' I guess this is what they mean."
News.Heading: Lionel Messi boot donation provokes angry response in Egypt
News.text: CAIRO: World Footballer of the Year Lionel Messi found himself the unlikely figure of controversy in Egypt after a local politician and a soccer official reacted angrily when he donated a pair of his boots to raise money for charity. MBC Masr channel broadcast an interview last Saturday with Barcelona's Messi on the television programme "Yes I am Famous", but the announcement that the Argentina forward would auction his boots for charity provoked an unexpected response. Member of parliament and television presenter Said Hasasin, appearing on his own talk show, took off his shoes and said he would donate them to the poor of Argentina. "Whose shoes do you want to sell, Messi? How much do you think it will get? You don't know that the nail of a baby Egyptian is worth more than your shoes? Keep your shoes to yourself or sell them to Israel." "Messi, we Egyptians are 90 million people, who have pride, we have shoes." "We don't eat off the money of other peoples' shoes. I would have understood if he donated his Barcelona uniform to the Egyptians, it's accepted. But just the shoes? It's humiliating to all Egyptians and I do not accept this humiliation. Egyptians may not find food, but they have pride." "We Egyptians have never been humiliated before during our seven thousand years of civilization." Throwing shoes is considered an insult in the Middle East. Hasasin called up Azmy Megahed, a spokesman for the Egyptian Football Association, on his programme, who added: "I am confused. If he (Messi) intends to humiliate us, then I say he'd better put these shoes on his head and on the heads of the people supporting him. We don't need his shoes and we don't need charity from Jewish or Israeli people. Give your shoes to your country, Argentina is full of poverty." MBC Masr's Mona El-Sharkawy who interviewed Messi said the gesture had been misinterpreted and that the donation was not for an Egyptian charity. "This is so false. It's a trend on our show that we take a souvenir from our guest and put it on auction for charity," El-Sharkawy was quoted as saying by news agency Ahram. "I am surprised, I didn't say we will be giving it to charity in Egypt or any other place. I don't know why they said he is presenting it to Egypt. This was never said." Messi has not commented on the reaction to his donation. Former Egypt forward Mido said he was grateful for Messi's gesture, writing on Twitter: "The most precious thing the writer owns is his pen ... and the most precious thing the footballer owns is his shoes. I hope we stop the false accusations."
News.Heading: South Africans try to see funny side of Jacob Zuma crisis
News.text: JOHANNESBURG: With their economy flatlining, currency on the ropes and politics in turmoil, many South Africans are turning to humour for relief, mainly at the expense of President Jacob Zuma and his $16-million home improvements. Within minutes of Zuma surviving Tuesday's heated impeachment vote in parliament thanks to unanimous support from African National Congress (ANC) loyalists, the 73-year-old traditionalist Zulu was facing another roasting on the nation's irreverent stand-up circuit. "Jacob Zuma is the dude who just threw up all over the dance floor but still doesn't want to go home," comedian Lazola Gola quipped, to roars of laughter at an open mike event at Kitchener's Bar, a 100-year-old watering hole built in the heyday of Johannesburg's gold rush. For comedians, Zuma is the gift that keeps on giving, a politician whose career has run the full gamut of scandal, from a love-child and corruption charges to foot-in-mouth insults of African countries and his belief, expressed during a 2006 rape trial, that having a shower can prevent transmission of HIV/AIDS. However, no episode has surpassed the six-year imbroglio over the "security upgrades" to his sprawling Nkandla private residence that included an amphitheatre, swimming pool, cattle enclosure and chicken run. Even though South Africa's top court said last week he had broken the constitution by disobeying a watchdog's order to pay back some money, Zuma has ploughed on, blaming his lawyers for giving bum advice and apologising for creating "confusion". That represented a rare moment of contrition from a leader who has mocked his non-Zulu opponents' pronunciation of Nkandla rolling his eyes in parliament and dragging out the main syllable, 'Nkaaaaaaaandla' and has criticized "clever blacks" for getting upset about the issue. Demonstrating political analysis as sharp as his wit, comedian Mojak Lehoko said Zuma's ability to ride out the constitutional court smack-down was no surprise. "This is a man who has survived more than 700 corruption charges and a rape case. There's no way he's going to jail over some home improvements and a swimming pool," he said backstage. Mad reality While much of South Africa's humour inevitably plays on the racial divides that remain two decades after apartheid particularly between blacks and whites the ruling ANC party and its leaders, past and present, are also frequent targets. Nor are there any sacred cows. In one Lehoko skit mocking the broken manner in which Zuma reads out large numbers in English, he and Mandela are sitting round a fire smoking marijuana, when the anti-apartheid leader accuses Zuma of hogging the joint. "Come on, Comrade Jacob, you know the rules two puffs and pass it on," Mandela says. "But I've only had one ...," Zuma protests. "Thousand, seven hundred and twenty eight." Zuma's reputation for gaffes in January his office had to correct his assertion Africa was bigger than all the other continents put together is even starting to make waves internationally. South African host of "Daily Show", Trevor Noah, explained to US audiences this week how Zuma was elected in 2009 without ever being formally cleared by a court of hundreds of corruption charges. "I know, I know, that should have been a red flag to South Africans but ever since apartheid we've strived to be colour blind, so all we saw was a flag," Noah said. Others have taken the view that the politics of the self-styled "Rainbow Nation" have become so bizarre that satire is unable to compete with the real thing. "April Fools' Day 2016 cancelled till further notice," Daily Maverick, a respected online political magazine, wrote on April 1. "We couldn't come up with anything half as mad as SA reality today. Sorry."
News.Heading: All eyes on Kejriwals visit to Goa on Sunday
News.text: PANAJI: Arvind Kejriwal's first rally in the state of Goa as Delhi chief minister will be closely watched by other political parties in the state on Sunday. Kejriwal will address a large gathering at Campal Grounds in the capital city on Sunday evening along with seven other speakers including Punjab MP Bhagwant Mann. AAP's national convenor will fly to Goa on Sunday afternoon and will be greeted by members of Goa's aboriginal Kunbi tribe from Nuvem. Members of the fishing community will also hand over a petition to him with a list of issues they're grappling with. In the past one week AAP's volunteers have personally handed invites to over two lakh households throughout the state and expect a strong response at the rally, the party's media coordinator in Goa, Rupesh Shinkre told TOI. Kejriwal has turned down the offer of staying at a fancy hotel, preferring to stay with one of the AAP volunteers in Panaji city for the night. On Monday morning, he will pay tribute to Goa's first chief minister Dayanand Bandodkar, the father of Goan nationalism, Tristao de Braganca Cunha and the father of Goa's Opinion Poll Dr Jack de Sequeira. He will then hold a closed-door volunteers' meeting before he catches a flight back to Delhi. Two days ago, the party that is gearing up for the 2017 assembly elections in the state, announced that it would contest all 40 seats and declared the names of 40 coordinators in the state who will act as a bridge between the party and the people. Senior AAP leader Ashutosh on Thursday said it is was historic for the party to have set up the first phase of its organization in the state within such a short span of time. "Even the biggest political parties have not accomplished the task of organizational development of such magnitude within such a short period of time. AAP has arrived with a dream to change Goa," he added. Pankaj Gupta, AAP national secretary, said the party wants to change governance and politics in the country. "Today we have an organizational set up with people who can respond to people in each constituency in Goa." Ashutosh said there is national appeal for the party which wants to offer an alternative to the conventional, traditional politics of money power, muscle power and communalism in the country.
News.Heading: Sonowal show expected to draw a lakh crowd
News.text: Guwahati: Excitement has reached fever pitch over the swearing-in ceremony of Sarbananda Sonowal , who will be the first BJP chief minister to take charge in the state ending 15 years of Congress veteran Tarun Gogoi's rule. The grand saffron show on May 24, to be graced by Prime Minister Narendra Modi and other luminaries of his cabinet, promises to be the biggest political extravaganza the state has seen till now. The venue, Khanapara Veterinary Playground, is expected to turn into a sea of humanity when Sonowal and his ministers take the oath of office and secrecy amid a thousand cheers. The administration is on its toes to ensure the high-profile event passes off peacefully. Deputy commissioner, Kamrup (Metro) district, M Angamuthu, said, "We are expecting a gathering of about one lakh people as the Prime Minister and other VIPs are coming. A multi-layer security has been arranged." The DC added that the administration will be installing toilets and other facilities around the venue for the convenience of the people. Sources in the police department said there will be CCTV cameras and parking arrangements and that they are firming up their plans. Youngsters like Jyotirmoy and Ananta plan to wear new kurtas on Tuesday. They said they would be there at the ground with their friends to witness the historic event. "From Tuesday, it will be a new journey for our state," gushed the two, and then said wisely, "We voted for change. But change does not mean change of government. The new government will have to usher in change." For some like Jibon Das, a teacher from Bongaigaon and an AGP supporter, it's like revisiting that moment in 1985 when the AGP came to power amid huge expectations. "This event sounds as promising as the Nehru stadium event of 1985. We expect the same grandeur at Sonowal's show," he said. The Federation of Industries & Commerce of North Eastern Region (FINER) said it is looking forward to the formation of a chief minister's high powered Economic Advisory Council on the lines of the Prime Minister's Economic Advisory Council, to address key economic issues of the state. "We expect the new government will implement their Vision Document 2016-2025, in letter and spirit and put the economy on the fast track and meet the expectations of all," said R S Joshi, chairman, FINER.
News.Heading: BJP mulls senior AGP leaders' roles in Assam
News.text: GUWAHATI: With the polls done and dusted, the next big question doing the rounds is how BJP will accommodate top Asom Gana Parishad (AGP) leaders like Prafulla Kumar Mahanta and Brindaban Goswami who are senior to CM-designate Sarbananda Sonowal. Though AGP, which won 14 of the 30 seats it contested, is silent on the issue of ministerial berths, party insiders said it will seek three cabinet posts. BJP had given 24 seats to AGP, but the regional party fielded candidates in six more constituencies. Most winners from AGP had served as state ministers in the eighties and nineties. Mahanta, who was twice the CM of Assam, has said he will follow his party's decision but sources said he would not be comfortable with an insignificant role. "As the big brother of the alliance, BJP will have a major role. I have no problem following what the party leadership decides," he has said. "Mahanta is a senior AGP leader. He does not want to leave politics. Now, it's up to the central leadership of BJP to utilize his experience," said an AGP insider. Earlier, there was speculation that Mahanta would be accommodated as governor or speaker. Former education minister and ex-AGP president Brindaban Goswami, who won from Tezpur, also faces a similar situation. It will be difficult for both Mahanta and Goswami to work under Sonowal who is much junior to them and who had worked under them when he was in AGP. Sonowal left AGP in 2011. "All the alliance parties will sit together and take a call on the issue. I want to serve the people after 15 years of Congress misrule," said AGP president Atul Bora, who won from Bokakhat. He said living up to the people's expectations is the party's priority. "This time, the expectations of the people are even higher than in 1985 when we first formed the government," Bora added.
News.Heading: ISIS mentions Gujarat in threat video, state ATS on alert
News.text: AHMEDABAD: Gujarat ATS sources on Saturday claimed that in the latest threat video from the dreaded terror outfit Islamic States in Iraq and Syria (ISIS), Gujarat has been specifically named as their potential target. In a map shown in the threat video, Gujarat has been specifically marked, said an ATS official. It is noteworthy that in a threat video earlier in September 2013, after the elimination of Osama bin Laden , Al Qaeda's no 2 Ayman-Al-Zawahiri had named Gujarat and Ahmedabad as their target "The video also mentioned details about 2002 Gujarat riots and Babri demolition in December 1992," said an ATS source. According to ATS sources, it is more important that during the interrogation of recently arrested IM suspect Alamzeb Afridi, allegedly a key accused in the July 2008 serial blasts, it came to light that Afridi has actually translated speeches of IS chief Abu Bakar Al Baghdadi into Gujarati and put them on Jehadi websites. "This itself was an indication that IS wants to target Gujarati youths through such provocative material. Afridi was in touch with Shafi Armar, supposedly based somewhere in Waziristan in Pakistan, and it was Shafi who has asked Afridi to translate Jehadi speeches of Baghdahi into Gujarati. Afridi has also expressed his desire to sneak through India to Syria to fight for the terror outfit," said an ATS official. Sources in ATS said May 21 was the day when former PM of India Rajiv Gandhi was assassinated and the day is marked as the terror fighting day. "On such day IS has issued the threat and we are taking it seriously," added a senior ATS official.
News.Heading: Anand couple scales Everest at age 50
News.text: AHMEDABAD: A couple from Anand town in central Gujarat scaled Mt Everest at age 50. Chetna Rana and her husband Pradip Sahu are the first such couple and among the few in the country to have achieved this feat. The couple had touched the sunmit at 8,848 mt above sea level on May 19, but could not share their joy with the rest of the world due to a slight change in the weather. The couple recently made it to the camp site just below the summit to finally announce their achievement. This was the couple's third attempt to scale Mt Everest. In the first unsuccessful attempt in 2014 there were reports of a major landslide and the death of 13 Sherpa men, which prompted the couple to abandon the expedition. In their second attempt in 2015, earthquakes were reported from the area. This was the couple's third attempt. The couple have been literal explorers and even teach mountaineering to aspiring volunteers. The couple has been pursuing the hobby for the last 30 years, and has spent their entire life's savings towards this expedition, claim their close relatives.
News.Heading: Heat claims six more in state, toll reaches 23
News.text: Ahmedabad: The killer heat waves in the state took toll of four more people in the city on Friday, while one each from Rajkot, Vadodara and Gandhinagar succumbed to the extreme climatic condition. With this death toll due to blistering heat touched 23 in the state. Considering the seriousness of the situation, Ahmedabad Municipal Corporation (AMC) has on Friday issued red alert for the city on Saturday warning that the maximum temperature is likely to touch 46 degrees. However, the mercury took a little dip on Friday and settled The deceased from the city include a one-year-old boy who was admitted to the AMC - run V S hospital succumbed to heat-stroke in the wee hours of Friday. Prince Parmar- the deceased, was first taken to a Viramgam based private hospital on Thursday but as his condition deteriorated, he was shifted to V S hospital, where he breatehed his laston Friday, Mahesh Parmar, deceased's father, said. While, a 20-year-old youth Mohammed Nazim, who was hospitalized in AMC -run Shardaben hospital on May 18 in critical condition, died due to heat wave on Friday, Dr K S Naik, in charge Resident Medical Officer of the hospital, said. Jyotiben Badani (32), a resident of Thakkar Bapanagar area here, who was hospitalized in Shardaben hospital since May 18, died due to heat stroke late on Thursday night, added Naik. Besides, a resident of Behrampura area Gemarbhai Parmar (45), who was hospitalized on May 18, lost his life due to the heat stroke on Thursday evening. A 28-year-old youth from Gandhinagar - Umedsinh Chavda, who was handling security of a private university, became the fifth victim of heat stroke. Umed, son of Police Inspector V L Chavda of Dahegam area, complained of vomiting and giddiness on Thursday night. Soon after that, his condition deteriorated and he went unconscious. However, Chavda called some family physician, but his efforts could not save his son's life. In Rajkot, an unidentified man around 60-year-old was found dead near K T Children's hospital in the city on Thursday night. Doctors on Friday confirmed that he died due to heat stroke. 21-year-old Daman resident Abhishek Yadav died after suffering a heat stroke on Thursday in Vadodara. He was found in an unconscious state at Vadodara Central Bus Station and was rushed to the city-based SSG Hospital, where he was pronounced dead. Yadav had visited the city for a pre-admission counselling session for an engineering course at a city based private institution.
News.Heading: 10 lions caged in hunt for man-eater
News.text: RAJKOT/AHMEDABAD: After a 14-year-old boy was attacked and preyed upon by a lioness in Ambardi village in Dhari range of Amreli, the forest department has captured 10 of the 14 lions seen in the region. Friday's attack was the third incident in the vicinity of Ambardi village in the last two months. Forest officials fear that one or more members of the pride could have become man-eater. However, this could only be ascertained after proper analysis and behavioural study of the wild cats. Experts believe that the pride of lions seemed to be a disturbed group. But they , too, do not rule out the possibility of any of them becoming man-eater. Chief conservator of forest A P Singh said, "There is a likelihood that one of the pride members may have become a man-eater as a result of which others could also get affected. We cannot ignore it and hence we have to cage the entire group and study their behaviour. " He said that there have been instances of leopards and tigers turning man-eaters, but never in case of lions. "Lions are also member of the flesh eating family and hence the possibility cannot be ignored," Singh added. Jayraj Devipujak was killed by a lioness while he was sleeping with his father in a mango orchard in Ambardi village. His body was later found about 500 metres from where he was sleeping. Jay raj's father Mahdu Devipujak, who tried to scare the wild animal was also injured in the attack. On Saturday, three teams from Dhari, Jasadhar and Sasan-Gir range were rushed to Ambardi. Forest officials said that they has successfully caged 10 lions and are in process of capturing the rest. Member of the National Wildlife Board, H S Singh said the group might be disturbed as they have been displaced because of the Ambardi interpretation project. "I feel, capturing the group is good as it help to know if more than one animal has tasted human flesh or not." Wildlife expert, Divyabhanusinh Chavda states that there was a possibility that disturbed animals can turn man-eater or attack humans.
News.Heading: Boy killed, preyed on by lioness
News.text: Rajkot: A 14-year-old boy was killed by a lioness while he was sleeping alongside his father in a mango orchard in Ambardi village of Dhari taluka in Amreli. This is the third such lion attack near Ambardi village. Forest officials said the common thing in these attacks is that the wild cat had preyed on humans in all three cases. Concerned over the seriousness of the issue, the forest department has issued orders to cage the entire pride of 14 lions found near the village and analyse their behaviour. The deceased boy was identified as Jayraj Devipujak. His body was later found about 500 metres from where he was sleeping. Jayraj's father Mahdu Devipujak, who tried to scare the wild animal, was also injured in the attack. "We have placed cages near the village to nab the pride of lion. According to our estimation, there are 14 lions in the pride seen around Ambaradi village," said Mahipatsinh Jadeja, assistant conservator of forests, Gir-East division, Dhari. Caging the entire pride is an unprecedented move by the forest department, said another forest official, adding that the decision was triggered because in the earlier two cases also the lion had preyed on the humans. According to forest officials, Jayraj was attacked by the lioness when he was asleep alongside his father in the mango orchard of Ambardi village sarpanch Nathabhai. The incident occurred around 3.30 am. Father of the deceased boy is an agricultural labourer and has been working in the farms of Nathabhai since last two years. Earlier, on April 10, lions killed 50-year-old Labhuben Solanki in Bharad village in Dhari taluka of Amreli, while she was asleep in an open field. Before that, lions killed Jinabhai Makwana (60) in Ambardi village on March 19. He too was asleep when the lion attacked him.
News.Heading: Kutch vessel sinks near Sharjah; 12 rescued, 1 missing
News.text: Rajkot: A cargo vessel, Al-Kaushar, with capacity of 350 tonnes from Mandvi town of Kutch sank in the sea near Sharjah coast on its way to Iran on Thusday afternoon. Over the total 13 crew members on-board, 12 were rescued by another vessel 'Virat' sailing with it. However, one of the crew member was still missing, said officer bearers of Kutch Vahanvata Association. The vessel was owned by Hajiahmed Agariya of Mandvi town and was taking cargo from Sharjah towards Iran. It was carrying general cargo like food grains and animals. "According to our information, fire was broke out in the engine room of the vessel after which it sank in the sea. A nearby ship came to rescue the crew members," said Adambhai Thaim, one of sailor leaders and member of Kutch Vahanvata Association. "The vessel left Sharjah on May 13 towards Iran. The fire in the engine room spread into vessel and it sank into the sea. Crew members are from Mandvi, Jamnagar and Valsad. The missing sailor was identified as Mahesh Bavaji, a resident of Mandvi town of Kutch," said Agariya, owner of the vessel. The vessels and dhow of Saurashtra and Kutch are engaged in sea transportation between middle-east and African countries. There are over 350 vessels with the capacity between 500 and 1000 tonnes in Saurashtra region engaged in sea transportation business.
News.Heading: 20-ft breach in Narmada canal submerges 300 acre land in Vav
News.text: Palanpur: Nearly 300 acres of land was submerged in water following a 20-feet wide breach in a minor Narmada canal passing through Mavsari village in Vav taluka of Banaskantha on Friday. Officials of the irrigation department rushed to the spot and started plugging the breach. Executive engineer of Narmada Nigam at Tharad CD Patel said, "The only way out is to shut the gates of main canal." While farmers said the breach had been caused due to the release of excessive water in the canal, the irrigation department officials at Thahrad said it had occurred due to a hole in the side wall of the canal. The farmers said knee deep water has inundated fields where ready crop of summer millet was lying. Millet is the only crop sown in the summer in the region. Agro scientist of Sardarkrishinagar Agricultural University Dantiwada (SADU) AM Patel said this is the season of summer millet in the Banaskantha. After crop cutting the millet was lying in the fields, no one can put aside the loss. How much loss the farmers had to suffer depends on the quantity of the produce and the actual area of the crop, he added. Meanwhile water flowing from the canal fields continued unabated. Water supply was resumed on May 15 during chief minister Anandiben Patel's visit to Krishimela here. She had announced release of Narmada water in the minor canal for irrigation.

News.Heading: How to open desktop versions of websites on iPhone
News.text: NEW DELHI: Nearly all websites these days have a responsive layout. They also come with separate 'mobile' versions that are automatically loaded when websites are accessed via smartphones. However, mobile versions of websites are optimized for speed and don't show the same amount of information as their desktop counterparts. If you're using an iPhone , there's help. Thanks to a built-in iOS feature, it's really easy to open desktop (or full) versions of websites on iPhone. Here's a step-by-step procedure to do it Smartphone users to cross 6 billion by 2020: Baidu With the growth of telecom industry, the number of smartphone users has increased significantly and by 2020, there will be 6.1 billion smartphone users worldwide. Step 1: Open up the website whose full version you want to access in iPhone's browser , as you always do. As expected, this will load the mobile version of the website. Now, tap the Share button. Step 2: This will bring up numerous sharing options (e.g. Facebook , Twitter ) for the website. Now, tap on the Request Desktop Site button. That's it. The browser will now load the 'desktop' version of the website. This tip works for almost all websites. iPhone SE review: Apple is more clever than you thought Apple's latest innovation iPhone SE may not be worth queuing up for. Also, it is exactly not the first iPhone for price conscious consumers in India. In addition, almost all websites have a dedicated option (mostly at the bottom of the webpage) that can be used to load their full desktop variants with one click. The ability to access full desktop versions of websites on iPhone can come in really handy, especially for websites whose mobile versions are limited or don't render properly. Try it out, and let us know your thoughts in the comments below.
News.Heading: The International 2016 Battle Pass is out and offering more things than ever
News.text: NEW DELHI: It's the time of the year that Dota 2 players from all over the world wait for. As 'The International 2016 Battle Pass' is out and things look better than they ever did. The first thing to note is that the Compendium is a part of the Battle Pass and is not the primary commodity to buy this time around. And like previous years, the Battle Pass can level up. However, this time the Battle Pass has rewards available till 2,500 level, which is a lot more than anything seen previously. This year a level 1 Battle Pass would cost $9.99 while the level 50 would cost $26.99 which is a dollar less than last time around. Extra levels can be bought as well and would cost $2.49 for 5 levels, $4.99 for 11 levels and $9.99 for 24 levels. The initial bundle comes with Immortal Treasure I, II and III apiece, a seasonal terrain, a Vengeful Spirit taunt item, Aurora weather item, The International 2016 music pack, The International 2016 cursor pack, an Onibi evolving courier, a Smeevil Penance evolving ward, an emoticon pack,The International 2016 HUD skin, loading screens, an Effigy Block of The International 2016 and a Crystal Maiden announcer pack. Games startups play to survive in the gaming space Gaming companies find that high number of downloads are no reflection of success. In order to improve retention levels, companies are increasingly focusing on localisation of games. There is a new Quest system where players will be able to choose paths and difficulties which will offer rewards accordingly. And players who reach level 225 will earn a Legion Commander immortal item. The wagering system that we saw in the last two Battle Passes of the Majors is back again and works just the same. A new addition is the Community Challenge where communities will have to complete objectives collectively to gain rewards. Valve is offering a new challenge to the whole Dota 2 community and will grant every Battle Pass owner with three 'Trust of the Benefactor' treasures if the total prize pool exceeds last year's, which was $18,429,613. Each 'Trust of the Benefactor' treasure will offer a chance to receive a 2016 Immortal Treasure, a Random Hero Set, an Arcana Set, or an ultra rare chance at one of the following limited-run prizes: 200 x Fire Lotus Belt 200 x Golden Ornithomancer Mantle 200 x Dragonclaw Hook 200 x Rainmaker 200 x Pipe of Dezun 200 x Perceptions of the Eternal Mind 200 x Kantusa The Script Sword 200 x Shattered Greatsword 200 x Golden Gravelmaw 100 x Drodo the Druffin 100 x Golden Grasping Bludgeon 100 x Golden Shards of Exile 100 x Golden Staff of Perplex 100 x Golden Huntling 100 x Golden Severing Crest 100 x Golden Sullen Hollow 100 x Golden Lamb to the Slaughter 100 x Lockjaw the Boxhound 50 x Golden Doomling 50 x Murrissey the Smeevil 50 x Ice Baby Roshan 50 x Fire Baby Roshan 25 x Guard of the Red Mist 25 x Axe of Phractos 25 x Monarch Bow 25 x Burning Fiend 25 x ??? ASUS unveils four gaming motherboards Mumbai, May 11 (IANS) Taiwan-based computer hardware company ASUS and Republic of Gamers (ROG) on Wednesday launched four new motherboards that provide advanced customisation flexibility to achieve extreme performance. Players will be able to predict the total amount of the prize money as well and will be rewarded with 10 levels for it. Another new addition this year is the Find Your Peak Rank option which will let the players achieve the highest MMR (Match Making Rating) they can and swap it with their present MMR by completing 40 games. The other unique new item introduced is the river vials which will give the river custom effects. These will come with charges and will change the texture of the river for 10 mins at a time. The most rare one among these is the Blood Vial which can be obtained by reaching level 2500. Other features include the Weekend Battle Cup, Arcana Voting, Battle Log and Compendium. The Immortal Treasure I has Immortal items of Enchantress, Omniknight, Timbersaw, Juggernaut, Phantom Lancer, Weaver and Faceless Void.
News.Heading: PickMyCart: An app to help you with laundry services
News.text: PANAJI: The most convenient way to do laundry and dry cleaning just got in town. An Android app PickMyCart which offers the opportunity to avail of laundry services at the touch of a button, was launched in Panaji on Friday. Designed by Goa-based start-up, Androcid Media, the app requires users to login with their credentials, following which the user's mobile number is verified. Once the desired service is selected, the user can add the required amount of clothing to the e-cart and send the command for laundry. Unlike most e-service, PickMyCart gives users the privilege to choose a delivery slot and pick up slot according to a date and time convenient to the user. Though in its first leg, the app is catering to laundry requirements, developers of the innovative app intend to further its services with the order and purchase of grocery, gas cylinders and fresh flowers.
News.Heading: Coolpad's most expensive smartphone Max: First impressions
News.text: NEW DELHI: Chinese smartphone manufacturer Coolpad has just launched its Coolpad Max smartphone in India. Priced at Rs 24,999, the smartphone will be competing with the likes of Xiaomi Mi 5 . We spent some time with the device and here are our first impressions. Design The design of the Coolpad Max seems heavily inspired from the iPhone 6S, with a metal body and curved glass screen with rounded edges. It also feels a little heavy in hand. The non-removable back panel of the Coolpad Max carries a 13MP rear camera with LED flash, fingerprint sensor and Coolpad branding. Volume keys are placed on the left whereas the power key is on the right. The 3.5mm audio jack, speaker unit and micro-USB port are placed at the bottom edge of the smartphone. The front is largely dominated by a 5.4-inch screen and there are no physical buttons. All in all, the design of the Coolpad Max seems pretty impressive. Coolpad takes on Xiaomi Mi 5; launches Max for Rs 25,000 As widely expected, Cooplad has launched its latest smartphone Max in India today. The smartphone will add to the companys mid-range portfolio and will be exclusively available on Display Coolpad Max features a 5.4-inch Full HD display with 1080x1920 pixels resolution. The display produces really sharp colours and has good visibility under the sun. Viewing angles are good as well. Hardware Coolpad Max is powered by a 1.5GHz octa-core Qualcomm Snapdragon processor paired with 4GB of RAM and 64GB of internal storage. During our brief time with the smartphone, it performed pretty well and we did not face any lag at all. However, we'll look into it more during our in-depth review. Software Coolpad Max runs Android 5.1.1 Lollipop with Coolpad's custom UI baked on top. The phone's UI has no app drawer and all app icons are displayed on the homescreen itself. The highlight of the smartphone is its 'Dual in One' system that creates two virtual spaces - Private and Main, inside the OS. Files, personal contacts and other information stored in the Private space are only accessible to the owner. It is also possible to create a separate phone book, WhatsApp account and more in the Private space. On the other hand, Main space lets both the owner and others to access apps and information just like any other smartphone. The phone comes preloaded with a number of apps including Facebook and WhatsApp. Some of the preloaded apps are specifically designed for Coolpad, such as Rock Wallpaper and Cool Services store. Camera The phone comes with a 13MP rear camera with LED flash and a 5MP front-facing snapper for selfies. Camera app is easy to use and the company has also incorporated different modes to enhance the photography experience. Judging by some of our quick test shots, the camera is capable of clicking good images with impressive amount of detailing. The selfie camera is appreciably good as well. Comparison: Coolpad Max vs Xiaomi Mi 5 Coolpad has just launched its latest smartphone Max in India. The handset flaunts a metal frame design and comes with a price tag of Rs 24,999. We compare the device with the recently- launched Xiaomi Mi 5 to see where it stands in terms of specifications. What we think The Coolpad Max is a good device in terms of specifications but is priced too high. However, for a more accurate opinion stay tuned for its complete review.
News.Heading: Now you can run 1.5 million Android apps on Chrome OS
News.text: Google Play Store has finally reached Chrome. At the recent Google I/O 2016 developer conference, the company announced the entry of Android apps in Chrome OS . Users are already able to run some of the Android apps on Chrome OS, but now Google is bringing all the 1.5 million Android apps to the Chromebooks. As Google wrote in a blog post, "This means you'll be able to download and use Android apps, so you can make a Skype call, work with Office files and be productive offline - or take a break with games like Minecraft, Hearthstone or Clash of Clans." Google I/O 2016: Now access Android Auto in non-compatible cars too To use the feature, all they would need to do is connect their smartphone with the vehicles infotainment system using either a 3.5mm auxilliary jack or Bluetooth wireless connectivity. The company further adds in the post that not only this gives a boost to the Chrome OS but will also make it easy for developers to bring their apps on the OS without any need to roll out an update. While Google has announced the Play Store support in Chrome OS, it is not rolling out to users right away. It will first come to the Chrome OS dev channel in June with the release of M53. The Google Play access in Chrome OS will first be hitting the Asus Chromebook Flip, the Acer Chromebook R 11 and the Chromebook Pixel (2015). Also, the Mountainview-based tech firm promises to bring Google Play to other Chromebook devices in future. Some of the partners that are already working to bring Android apps to their Chromebooks include Acer, Asus, Dell, Haier, Lava (Xolo Chromebook), HP, Lenovo, Samsung, Toshiba and more. Google I/O 2016: Home, Allo and other takeaways A new virtual-reality system from Google and a way to use Android apps without downloading Android apps are among the highlights at the company's annual developer showcase in Mountain View, California. As Venturebeat reports it, the Google Play icon will be visible at the bottom left corner near the search icon. Users will also be able to bring their settings and app credentials from Android to the Chrome OS. The Google Play Store will be available on Chrome OS as an update. When the update reaches Chromebook devices, users will get a notification. They will be able to install the update once they accept the store's terms and conditions. Multitasking also gets easier with Android apps on the Chrome OS. Users will be able to view the Android apps in three different window sizes, making it easy to work on different apps simultaneously. For those wondering, there won't be any changes coming to the existing Chrome Web Store.

Lenovo seems all geared up to take the lead in the budget Indian smartphone market. After its own 'K' series and the highly successful Moto series from its now-owned Motorola stable, the company has now brought its ZUK sub-brand to India. Lenovo's online-only sub-brand, ZUK is set to compete against the likes of Xiaomi, LeEco, and OnePlus. The Z1 is the first smartphone in India to bear the ZUK branding, and comes with Lenovo's promise of quality. One look at ZUK Z1's specifications is enough to remind anyone of the much talked about OnePlus One. While the OnePlus One is dated now, the Z1 is looking to gain some marketshare with its competitive price tag of Rs 13,499. Read also: Lenovo ZUK Z1 first flash sale ZUK Z1 has entered India almost a year late, and the market is now packed with feature packed Android smartphones that cost under Rs 15,000. In fact, the newly launched Moto G4 Plus by Lenovo-owned Motorola is also similarly priced. So with numerous affordable smartphones already rubbing shoulders against each other, does the ZUK Z1 stand a chance in the Indian smartphone market? Read our detailed review to find out. Design and display The ZUK Z1 looks simplistic yet attractive. It boasts a metal frame paired with a plastic rear panel. Build quality is surprisingly good and the phone is lightweight as well. The fingerprint scanner perfectly blends with the front glass panel and thus, doesn't stick out. Despite having a 5.5-inch screen, the device is very handy. The curved back helps a lot with the grip as well. This smartphone comes with a massive 4,100mAh battery and Lenovo has done a good job in tackling the weight of the device. The front panel is nothing unique, and looks similar to any other budget smartphone. ZUK Z1 offers a 5.5-inch Full HD display of 1,080x1,920 pixels resolution, with pixel density coming at around 401ppi. Overall, the display quality is decent. The panel offers good colour reproduction and contrast ratio. The viewing angles are decent too. However, It is not easy to use the phone under direct sunlight due to the reflective display. Performance and camera The ZUK Z1 is powered by a quad-core 2.5 GHz Qualcomm Snapdragon 801 processor paired with 3GB RAM and 64GB of internal memory. While the processor is dated, it's still flagship-class and thus shouldn't be an issue for most users. The fact that it's included in a phone priced at Rs 13,499 only makes things better. Overall, the device proved to be really smooth during our testing. We didn't experience any hiccups while multi-tasking, even with intensive apps. Gaming performance was good too. Lenovo ZUK Z1 is among the cheapest smartphones that offer 64GB of in-built storage. However, there is no microSD card slot. The ZUK Z1 is not a phone to run benchmark tests on as it houses a pretty old processor, and the same will reflect in the scores. But for spec lovers who aren't willing to spend beyond Rs 15,000, this phone ticks all the right boxes. ZUK Z1 is a dual-sim smartphone with 4G support for both. It is backed by a 4,100mAh battery that easily lasted us a full day with moderate use. The phone also comes with a USB Type-C port. The best feature of the ZUK Z1 has to be its software. It offers a welcome change from typical custom UIs found on most Chinese smartphones. The phone runs Cyanogen OS 12.1 based on Android 5.1.1 Lollipop. With Cyanogen OS, users not only get to enjoy a different experience but also extensive customization. This is ideal for users who love to tweak the look and feel of their smartphones regularly. Cyanogen OS ran smoothly on the phone, without any bugs or errors. On the camera front, there is a 13MP rear camera with dual LED flash and optical image stabilization along with an 8MP selfie shooter. The camera is fast and captured some decent shots during our testing. However, low light images didn't turn out to be that good. The 8MP camera on the front delivered appreciably good selfies as well. Verdict At a price of Rs 13,499, the ZUK Z1 is a perfect budget smartphone. It's one of the very few smartphones about which you'll likely have very little to complain. Lenovo ZUK Z1 delivers on all fronts, and can be considered as a cheaper OnePlus One. However, the real challenge for prospective buyers will be deciding between the ZUK Z1 and the recently launched Moto G4 Plus.
